name: Grimmon
summary: Grimmon is the main villain of Digimon World: Dawn/Dusk. For unknown reasons, he was hellbent on completely destroying the Digital World.

name: Ying (Power Sphera Universe)
summary: Ying is BoBoiBoy's close friend, Yaya's best friend and a defender of Earth. She bears the Power Band of time manipulation, which allows her to appear as moving in super-speed in comparison to everyone else.

name: Yoffee
summary: Yoffee was the Brave Warrior of the Human Realm 300 years ago that defeated the Demon King alongside his companions and Riot. After the defeat of the Demon King, Yoffee was betrayed by his party members, and was killed by them out of fear and envy for his strength. In the modern day story, Yoffee was revived by Luna years ahead of schedule as one of the Seven Deadly Sins, bearing the Sin of Rage, and became the new Demon King. Now burning with rage, Yoffee wants to destroy the humans who betrayed him and end Chrono Life.

name: Andros (Iron Man: Armored Adventures)
summary: Andros Stark is from a future where his grandfather, Tony Stark, created Vortex, an artificial intelligence that was supposed to be used for the betterment of humanity, but it infected the computers of S.H.I.E.L.D. and took control of the entire internet. Vortex then judged that humanity was evil and caused the extermination of all human life on Earth. Andros traveled back to the past to prevent this doomsday future from happening.

name: Cross (Maximum Conviction)
summary: Cross is a private security contractor and former Marine. He and his fellow security contractor Manning were sent to decommission a black site, specifically designed for "people of interest." Their plans were brought to a halt when a team of mercenaries attempted to extract two of their inmates.

name: Anti-Skill
summary: Anti-Skill (警備員 (アンチスキル) Keibi-in (Anchi Sukiru), lit. Guard) is the term used to refer to Academy City's police and security forces.

name: Nephilim (Interface Series)
summary: An unknown group of strangers that beset upon the Painted Black tribe in the Watcher Narrative, possibly related to The Nephilim or Fallen Angels described in the Black Jesus Narrative, are an unnamed group of creatures who The Crone warns the River Tribe of, asking them to send sacrifices to them to stave off the tribe's destruction.

name: Gloria (Madagascar)
summary: Gloria is one of the four main protagonists alongside her other three friends Alex, Marty and Melman of the Madagascar franchise and its specials. She is one of the two tritagonists of Madagascar, a major character of Madagascar: Escape 2 Africa and a supporting character of Madagascar 3: Europe's Most Wanted.

name: Stargirl (Smallville)
summary: Stargirl was the protege of the Star Spangled Kid, Sylvester Pemberton. Despite initial conflict with the Justice League, she later joined after the battle with the Icicle. She assisted the League in the final battle against the Manhunters and Monitors.

name: Nier (Granblue Fantasy)
summary: Nier is a young woman who had her existence denied at every turn, thus leading to an overwhelming desire for love and acceptance which gradually warped the very fabric of her being. As her sense of morality began to wane, she came upon the Arcarum grim reaper who grants death to all. The two now stand together like lovers, hell-bent on creating a new world that will fully acknowledge them.

name: Rossweisse (Waltraute)
summary: Rossweisse is the youngest of the nine Valkyrie sisters. She specializes in defensive power, using a special aurora armor.

name: Tomo Aizawa
summary: Tomo Aizawa (相沢 智 Aizawa Tomo) is the protagonist of Tomo-chan wa Onnanoko!.

name: Splodyhead
summary: Experiment 619 was the 619th genetic experiment created by Jumba with Hämsterviel's funding. He was designed to use his fiery plasma blasts to cause massive chaos and damage. 619 and the other first 624 experiments were deactivated and smuggled to Earth by Jumba during his mission to capture Experiment 626.

name: The Delivery Boy (VCRPG)
summary: The Delivery Boy is one of the playable characters in No Delivery, and the employee that the player starts with when beginning the game. They were hired on by The Manager to work as an employee of Stezzoni's Pizzeria, but can quickly find themselves uncovering the darker secrets of the restaurant during their night shifts.

name: Zeruel
summary: Zeruel is the Fourteenth Angel, and one of the most powerful: the deadliest of the Angels that focus on direct, conventional combat. It is among the three to penetrate NERV Headquarters, and the only one to do so through a direct assault.

name: Gazel Dwargo (Light Novel)
summary: Gazel Dwargo is the third generation king of Dwargon. He is renowned as a great hero and celebrated as a wise king for his impartial rule.

name: Plutia (Hyperdimension Neptunia)
summary: Plutia (プルルート, Pururūto), also known as Iris Heart (アイリスハート, Airisu Hāto) is the Goddess of the Planeptune in the Ultra Dimension. She first makes her debut in Hyperdimension Neptunia Victory.

name: The Vestige
summary: The Vestige, also known as the Soulless One, and later Meridia's Champion, the Hero of Coldharbour, and the Savior of Tamriel, is the player character and main protagonist in The Elder Scrolls Online. They were one of the many mortals captured by the Worm Cult and used in unholy rituals, being sacrificed to Molag Bal by Mannimarco himself. After death, their soul was taken to the Daedric realm of Coldharbour, where it remained locked within the Wailing Prison. There he was contacted by another entrapped spirit referring to himself as "The Prophet", in fact the former Emperor Varen Aquilarios in disguise, who informed they had an essential part to play in stopping Molag Bal's schemes.

name: Bloop (The Bloop Diet)
summary: Bloop is a large fish that is responsible for the Bloop sound in 1997.

name: Shulker
summary: The Shulker is a kind of monster found in the End, particularly in the End Cities. They camouflage themselves as blocks until a target comes nearby.

name: Shynee
summary: Shynee are a slime-like species of monsters from Puzzle and Dragons. They are somewhat mysterious jelly-like creatures, very little is known about why they have unique marks compared to other slime monsters.

name: Berotha Magia
summary: Berotha Magia is the first Magia to ever be fought by Kamen Rider Zero-One. It was previously Gut Buster Taro, a comedian Humagear who was hacked by Jin to spread chaos.

name: Contender
summary: Contender is a villainous mercenary in Ward. Formerly known as The Pug, short for Pugilist, he used to take on random capes for bets placed online, before graduating to using his skillset to take down Kill Orders instead. Post Gold Morning, he rebranded as Contender and sold his services to Cradle, becoming part of the army opposing Victoria Dallon and the rest of Breakthrough.

name: Dough-Goo
summary: Dough-Goo are the most common fodder footsoldiers of the GEATHJERK Federation. The name "Dough-Goo" comes from the battle exoskelteton that the soldiers wear, which would eventually come to refer to the soldiers wearing the suit in combination with the suit itself.

name: Mordru
summary: Mordru is an evil entity, the most prominent Lord of Chaos who is fated to survive even after the end of the universe.

name: Jiraia
summary: Danzo Tobita (鳶田 段蔵, Tobita Danzou), more commonly known as Jiraia the Spider (蜘蛛手の地雷亜), was born into a samurai clan and was a prodigy in the ninja arts. He used to be a member of the Oniwabanshuu, working under the Shogun, the founder and former leader of the Hyakka, former leader of the Red Spiders (Benigumoto) and Tsukuyo's master. He is the main antagonist of the Red Spider Arc.

name: Phantom Foxy (FNAF World)
summary: Phantom Foxy is one of the playable characters in the rpg, FNaF World.

name: Ancient One (Marvel Cinematic Universe)
summary: The Ancient One was the Sorcerer Supreme and leader of the Masters of the Mystical Arts. She taught Kaecilius, Karl Mordo, Wong, and many others in the ways of sorcery.  Her unusually long life is fuelled by her energy use from the Dark Dimension, a technique she prohibits others from doing. When Kaecilius challenged the Ancient One's ways and stole a spell from the forbidden Book of Cagliostro, the Ancient One was determined to prevent Kaecilius from summoning Dormammu to the Earth.

name: Yuzuha Lee
summary: Lee Yuzuha is a professional Chinese Kung Fu martial artist and the former reigning Grand Champion of the Slaughter Colosseum's Female Division. Known for her exceptional agility and precision, Yuzuha combines traditional martial arts with a tactical approach to combat, making her a formidable fighter despite her petite stature.
abilities: Cover
Fighting outfit
Casual

name: Ozletc, the Sky Piercer
summary: Ozletc, the Sky Piercer is one of the Psion Flayer sisters who took command of the remnants of the Red Legion during the events of Season of Dawn. She's oldest of her siblings and regarded as the wisest. She protected Niruul, while she repurposed Osiris's failed experiment, the Sundial. Using this device they fractured time on Mercury, creating windows into alternate versions of the past, present and future. Ozletc would go on to hide within Mercury's future with the goal of manipulating it to their advantage and overwriting the current timeline with it.

name: Baal, The Gate of Hell
summary: Baal ("The Master"), its the Messenger XXI, one of the entities that will bring the end of the world. Born from the events from the War of God, people wished to be a justification of all suffering, grief and misfortune of mankind, and from that idea and the amalgamation of gods corpses and demons, Baal became real. Its the concept of evil that inhabits the Nexus of Souls, created by humankind to justify everything bad that happened to them.

name: Liore
summary: Liore is the Vice-Leader of the Heavenly Ream and the younger sister of Riot. 300 years ago when Riot descended to the Human Realm to aid Yoffee against the Demon King, Liore became the Leader of the Heavenly Realm in the place of Riot. Fearing of Riot being punished by God his indulgence, Liore descends to the Human Realm and captures Riot, nearly killing Habaek in the process. Ji-U Lee takes the quest to save Riot and ascends to the Heavenly Realm to face Liore. Liore has high affection for her brother, even bearing his Sin of Sloth, and willing to go to war against the Human Realm for killing her brother.

name: Bit (Mega Man X)
summary: Bit, known as Vajurila FF (ヴァジュリーラＦＦ Vajurīra FF) in Japan, is one of the members of the Nightmare Police, along with his partner Byte. He is sent to hunt Mega Man X during the events of Mega Man X3.

name: Jester (Horrorclix)
summary: From what can be gathered, Sunny was just an average man who had snapped and began decapitating people. Eventually he was caught and gunned down, but came back to life.

name: PC Principal
summary: PC Principal is a politically correct character in South Park. He was originally intended to be a one-off villain who eventually stayed due to his popularity.

name: Gyaos (Gamera -Rebirth-)
summary: Gyaos has been confirmed as one of Gamera's five foes in the upcoming Netflix Original animated miniseries GAMERA -Rebirth-, which will stream in 2023.

name: Jack the Ripper (Jack the Ripper: Hell Blade)
summary: Victor Frankenstein, more commonly known by his nickname Jack the Ripper is the titular protagonist of Jack the Ripper: Hell Blade. Created over 400 years ago, Victor is Doctor Frankenstein's artificial man and the only fully revived human in history, brought back to life by the blade Excalibur, implanted as a device that regulates the energy within his body. Victor now works as a bloodthirsty demon hunter, serial killer, and mercenary for the Illuminati.

name: Cynder (The Legend of Spyro)
summary: Cynder is a black dragon who appeared in The Legend of Spyro series.

name: Alatreon
summary: Alatreon is a monster capable of destroying the world. Some locals even believe that the Alatreon is a god or demon which is transformed into an Elder Dragon. Alatreons are very territorial. This may be the reason why no other monsters live in the Sacred Land. Alatreon might attack most of its prey from the air, giving it an advantage over most other monsters. It also is very aggressive towards flying objects, mainly airships.

name: Billy the Clown
summary: Billy is a tall pudgy clown animatronic, and reccuring minor character in The Walten Files

name: Sortiliena Serlut
summary: Sortiliena Serlut (ソルティリーナ・セルルト, Sorutirīna Seruruto) is a supporting character in the Alicization Arc. She was the mentor of Kirito during his first year in the «North Centoria Imperial Sword Mastery Academy», and the second-seat elite swordswoman at the Academy, where she was known as the «Walking Tactics Manual» (歩く戦術総覧, Aruku Senjutsu Souran). She graduated as the first-ranked swordsman from the academy after defeating the first-seat swordsman Uolo Levanteinn during the graduation tournament and participated in the Norlangarth North Empire Swordsmanship Tournament, where she was defeated by Eldrie Woolsburg.

name: Sam (Brandon Rogers)
summary: Sam is the main protagonist of Stuff & Sam!, and is the host of the show. Sam is a very flamboyant and outspoken man that isn't afraid to put himself out there just for the fun of it. In the plot of Stuff and Sam! Sam tries to adopt a baby but is stopped at every turn, soon finding out that there has been a secret operation running underneath the baby adoption agency, Thrust Babies, the whole time.

name: Phantom Presence
summary: The Phantom Presence is the final boss of WaveLand. It created the world and ascended to a higher ground. It resides within the Nightmare realm.

name: Arpin Lusène
summary: Arpin Lusène, also known as Le Chevalier Noir (The Black Knight), is a French gentleman and notorious thief. He has an cheesy French accent, even when he writes. His goal is to steal Scrooge McDuck's money, or make it disappear to make people think he stole it, and be remembered as the greatest thief of all time. His nickname, "The Black Knight", came from the black catsuit he wears during his stealth heists. Later on, he managed to get his hands on one of Gyro Gearloose's inventions: the Universal Solvet, a thick black liquid that can instantly dissolve anything besides diamonds. He coated a suit of armor and a sword covered in diamonds with it, making his nickname of The Black Knight all the more fitting. Only the hands, feet and handle of his sword are not coated by the Universal Solvent.

name: Sterling Archer
summary: Sterling Malory Archer, primarily known as Archer, is the main protagonist of the eponymous show who is considered to be the world's deadliest spy.

name: Ninja (Sonic the Hedgehog)
summary: Ninja (ニンジャ) are tall, thin robots that roam the Starfall Islands through several variants across them (including the Shinobi variant on Chaos Island, as well as the Kunoichi and Master Ninja(+) variants on Ouranos). Serving as a type of Guardian, a group of particularly powerful robots across the Starfall Islands comprised of digital energy, Ninjas and their variants act as mini-bosses for Sonic the Hedgehog to encounter and defeat for various items along his journey to save his friends.[1]

name: Kurumi Mugen
summary: Kurumi Mugen was one of the 11 girls chosen to become magical girls to fight in what would later be called the Distonia War against the invading magical beast from the Spirit World. Holding the codename War Nurse, Kurumi was recruited into the group by Asuka Otori and grew very attached to her. She was part of the Magical Five, the 5 surviving magical girls who defeated the king of the magic beasts during the final battle of the war. After said battle, Kurumi worked as a researcher for the JGSDF's central research division, furthering Japan's magic development.

name: Serial Designation N
summary: Serial Designation N, or simply N, is the deuteragonist of Murder Drones.

name: Caliborn
summary: Caliborn, also known by his chat handle, undyingUmbrage, is Calliope's "brother", the other, opposed existence within her body. Even amongst evil cherubs, Caliborn is extremely malicious and is obsessed with death and destruction, which he seeks to spread and enjoy as he pleases for the simple reason that he can and he wants to. As with his sister, his title is one of the rare and powerful master classes; he is the Lord of Time.

name: Anarky (Post-Crisis)
summary: A possible child of the Joker and Linda Penman, Lonnie Machin was a prodigal high school student until influence from anarchist philosophy turned him into the aptly-named vigilante Anarky. Though he was taken down by Batman and sent to a juvenile detention center, he soon escaped to become a consistent adversary to both the Batman and the criminals of Gotham City.

name: Touma Mia
summary: Touma Mia is the sister of Touma Taiga, and one of Savior Candidates.

name: Kenichiro Doman
summary: Kenichiro Doman (道満 拳一郎, Dōman Ken'ichirō) is a supporting character in the Bucchigiri series.
abilities: Superhuman Physical Characteristics
Martial Arts (Is the most skilled martial artist in Bucchigiri)
Social Influencing ( Leadership - Is the 43rd leader of Minato Kai. He can gather his men to start wars at any moment needed, shown in the Battle of Minato Kai vs Siguma )

Supernatural Willpower ( Entered a "battle of wills" with Marito to settle the score and fought for an extended period of time after suffering injuries . Would not go down after Matakara merged with Ichiya and began beating him relentlessly )
Analytical Prediction ( Could see through all of base Matakara's movements )

name: Alta Face
summary: Alta Face is a being that is the source of all Magic Power in Elentear. It is also the origin of all of the Hands that appear in Elentear. The Hands are similarly structured to the Magic Council's Face, wherein they are all extending from the ground in various places but are all connected to the main body Alta Face. Over many years, the Whiteout Village waged war against Alta Face, eventually sealing it underground. Later on, the Hands started appearing all over Elentear and the villagers soon realized that it is a part of the Alta Face and decided to track and cut them off. After several centuries, it was revealed that the Hands harbored no ill intent and despite giving rise to Tsumeakas on occasions, it is still considered a rare occurrence.

name: East
summary: East (이스트, Iseuteu) is one of the Four Great Witches and the Witch Who Governs the Magic of Death and Rebirth. She is the master of Surtr and Etwal who was her Sorella and front man until 17 years ago.

name: Ika Musume
summary: Ika Musume (translated into English as Squid Girl) is the titular character of the manga and anime series Shinryaku! Ika Musume! She’s a strange, squid-like creature that had come to the surface to invade humanity as punishment for invading the oceans.

name: Isuzu (Log Horizon)
summary: Isuzu is a Human Bard-Nomad and is one of the players trapped in Elder Tale. A former member of Hamelin and the Crescent Moon Alliance, she is currently a member of Log Horizon.

name: Nolan Booth
summary: Nolan Booth is one of the most wanted art thieves in the world. He wanted to prove himself to be the best by working with Special Agent John Hartley to take down Sarah Black, better known as "the Bishop" who claims to be the best in the world.

name: Svartáljǫfurr
summary: Svartáljǫfurr was the king of the Dark Elves and led them during their occupation of the Ringed Temple during the events of Kratos and Atreus's journey through the Nine Realms. He would continuously send his soldiers to attack the two to prevent them from unblocking The Light before engaging them in a fight himself.

name: Donatello (Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles)
summary: Donatello, or simply Donnie, is a protagonist of the television series, Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles. Just like his other incarnations, He is the brains of the group and is proficient in all kinds of technology and mechanics. Unlike his other incarnations however, he is much more cocky and confident. Not afraid to say what's on his mind or make rash actions.

name: Fire Spirit Cookie
summary: Fire Spirit Cookie is a Legendary-class Cookie and a playable character in CookieRun: Ovenbreak. Initially a normal Cookie who lived in the Dragon World, Fire Spirit Cookie stole the Red Dragon's Bead in order to gain complete mastery over the power of flame. Ever since, Fire Spirit Cookie has been traveling across both the Cookie World and the Dragon World, flaunting his power everywhere he could.

name: Lenka Utsugi
summary: Lenka Utsugi is an original character and main protagonist debuting in the God Eater anime series. He is a counterpart to the protagonist of the first God Eater game. Lenka also appeared in God Eater Resurrection as a DLC default appearance for the Protagonist, complete with hairstyle, face, eye color, voice, costume and God Arc.

name: Silver the Hedgehog (Archie Pre-Genesis Wave)
summary: Silver the Hedgehog is a Mobian Hedgehog on a mission from roughly 200 years into the future[1] within the Sonic the Hedgehog series and its spin-offs published by Archie Comics.

name: Dustin Henderson
summary: In 1983, when Dustin's friend, Will went missing, Dustin and the rest of his friends, Mike and Lucas went out to look for him, only to find a mysterious girl named Eleven who had telekinetic powers. Dustin had a neutral opinion of Eleven as she helped them look for Will, but he became good friends with her after she saved him and Mike from being killed by their school bullies. Dustin would continue to help his friends find Will and fight against a Demogorgon until it was killed by Eleven. In the end, Dustin and his friends were reunited with Will where they celebrated Christmas together.

name: William Foster
summary: William "Bill" Foster is a mentally ill divorced father. Over a month after he was fired, he went on an increasingly destructive rampage to reach his daughter's birthday party, despite his ex-wife's restraining order.

name: Purple Worm
summary:
A powerful beast, the Purple Worm is a massive worm which tunnels in the ground in constant search of food, the tunnels it leaves behind are often used by other underground races as living places.
In combat a Purple Worm simply tries to sting, bite and swallow its prey until it's dead.

name: Artemis (Fortnite)
summary: Artemis is a Character introduced during Chapter 5: Season 2. She can be found in Lavish Lair. Scout Specialist and a master of stealth and strategy, Artemis believes life is like an honorable hunt, and those who break the rules of the hunt can no longer be trusted. No matter how powerful they think they are.

name: Wraith (Fairy Tail)
summary: Wraith is a Fifth Generation Dragon Slayer and member of Diabolos, a guild of dragon eaters.

name: Rezmir the Black
summary: Rezmir is a black half-dragon warrior placed in charge of a regional sect of the Cult of the Dragon, an organization dedicated to furthering Tiamat's goals across the plains. Around the time of Rezmir's leadership, the cult grew greatly in power and began to enact a plan to bring living dragons to great power, and eventually summon the Dragon Queen herself.

name: Rin Asano
summary: Rin Asano (Jpn. - 浅野 凛 - "Asano Rin") is one of the two main characters of the manga Blade of the Immortal, the other being Manji. She is currently sixteen years old. Rin is the sole survivor of an Ittō-ryū massacre at Anotsu's hand and heir to her father's sword school, the "Mutenichi-ryū". She has mediocre swordsmanship skills but an intense desire to avenge the brutal death of her family. At the beginning of the series, she is portrayed as somebody who is trying to act mature but is still very childish - as the series progresses she steadily "grows up" and loses much of her naivety. She hires Manji as her bodyguard in this quest. However, it's not as simple as that - Rin is constantly torn by doubt over the righteousness and validity of her mission and fears becoming a hypocrite as Anotsu claims that she is more like the Ittō-ryū, especially when he remarks she chooses to use throwing knives instead of a sword like the "Mutenichi-ryū" teaches. She meets Anotsu at one point, but he claims that she is more like the Ittō-ryū as she continues her path for revenge. Anotsu's words are causing her to doubt. When she finally encounters Anotsu in Kaga, she realizes she cannot defeat him and winds up traveling with him. If he starts to trust her, she might get the chance she wants to kill him. But Anotsu is no fool and is fully aware of what she is doing, despite this he allows her presence. She has since left his company, vowing that she will eventually kill him; yet she will stand back for the time being and watch how the events unfold. It is also worth noting that she kisses a sleeping Manji in the fourteenth volume, Last Blood, and has shown on numerous occasions that she develops feelings towards him. They are as of now largely unreciprocated. She has three weapons, a Chinese sword named Kutoneshirika which she carries in a Toju (purse-like scabbard of sorts), a Tantō type dagger and a set of small throwing daggers named Ogunchu (Golden Wasps). Even though she is only mediocre in terms of fighting ability, Rin is still more skilled with weapons than most women of that time period and the fact that she carries a small arsenal of weapons with her makes her somewhat unique. She first appears in Conquest part 1.

name: King Shark (Arkham Series)
summary: Nanaue, also known as King Shark, was a serial killer captured by Amanda Waller to aid Task Force X on a mission to infiltrate the Arkham Asylum and retrieve a pen drive containing confidential information about illegal government activities.

name: Scanty Daemon
summary: Scanty Daemon is a major character in Panty & Stocking with Garterbelt. She is a female, red-colored demon, with green spiky hair, yellow/green eyes and fangs. She was originally said to be the mayor's daughter; however, this was later revealed to be a cover-up for their activities. She is the older of the demon sisters. Scanty is Panty's counterpart and rival. Scanty is obsessed with rules, regulations, and conformity, as opposed to Panty and Stocking's more erratic and unruly behavior. She is, however, quite excitable, and becomes extremely frustrated when things don't go her way. Scanty enjoys bringing pain and humiliation to others. She hates the Anarchy sisters, and she believes her mission is to destroy Panty first since she hates her more than Stocking. Along with her sister, Kneesocks, she comes up with various schemes to kill or at least humiliate both Panty and Stocking.

name: Impmon (Ai and Mako)
summary: Impmon is a main character in Digimon Tamers, being the partner Digimon of Ai and Mako.

name: Demogorgon (Dungeons and Dragons)
summary: All Demons seek the title of Prince of their kind. However, only one has achieved the title and defeats all those who seek to claim it from him. Demogorgon is an ancient evil that predates the majority of his kin. The strongest known Demon Lord and Prince of his kind, Demogorgon wages war on the entire multiverse in order to achieve the ultimate goal of Demon kind, which is the obliteration of everything, including himself.

name: Patchwork (DC Showcase)
summary: Elliot Taylor, also known as Patchwork, is a member of the Creature Commandos, a group of supernatural soldiers created by Lt. Matthew Shrieve. They were lead by Sgt. Rock in a covert mission to retrieve a powerful weapon from the nazis.

name: The Player (3008)
summary: The Player is an unofficial name given to the controllable character of 3008. They must survive by collecting food, building bases and avoiding Employees.

name: Haruki Sagae
summary: Haruki Sagae (寒河江 春紀) is one of the students of Black Class competing to kill Haru Ichinose in exchange for anything they desire. She is the eldest of ten siblings, born to a poor family, and she took on assassination as a job to help support her family. Her wish is that her family will get enough money to support themselves for the rest of their lives, even if she dies, planning to kill herself along with Haru so she can be free from her responsibilities and save her family.

name: Alex Cross
summary: Doctor Alex Cross is a forensic psychologist and detective with the Washington, D.C. Police Department. He is also a best-selling author who has gone up against serial killers and kidnappers.

name: Allen the Alien (TV Series)
summary: Allen or Allen the Alien was a Unopan and a representative of the Coalition of Planets. He was born from breeding camps that were designed as a way to repopulate the Unopans after they were almost wiped out by the Viltrumites, as well as a sort of counter-measure against them. While his role as a Viltrumite counter-measure had not succeeded, he would go on to became an evaluation officer for the Coalition, visiting different planets across various galaxies in hope to find a warrior strong enough to go against the Viltrumites.

name: Amorges (Assassin's Creed)
summary: Amorges (died c. 422 BCE) was a leader of the Order of the Ancients who operated in the Achaemenid Empire during the 5th century BCE.

name: Eis Shenron
summary: Eis Shenron (三星龍, San Shinron; lit. "Three-Star Dragon") is one of the seven Shadow Dragons, the sixth to be fought by Goku. Eis is the dragon of the Three-Star Dragon Ball, and is the twin brother of Nuova Shenron. His elemental power is that of ice.

name: Shadow the Hedgehog (Paramount)
summary: Shadow the Hedgehog is a character that appears in the Sonic the Hedgehog film series. He is an anthropomorphic alien hedgehog who fell to Earth in a meteor and became part of a secret government experiment called Project Shadow led by Professor Gerald Robotnik. Upon his arrival, Shadow befriended Gerald's granddaughter, Maria. However, the Guardian Units of Nations, believing Shadow to be a threat, invaded Gerald's laboratory, causing an explosion that killed Maria while Shadow was placed in a state of suspended animation.

name: Aquilo
summary: Aquilo is one of the few remaining dragons left in the material world.

name: AncientKazemon
summary: AncientKazemon is an Ancient Bird Man Digimon possessing the attribute of "Wind", it is one of the legendary Ten Warriors Digimon that saved the ancient Digital World. A Mega who existed only in the distant past, it has golden wings and a beautiful rainbow-colored figure. With its golden wings it soars around the vast skies, and it is said that by erecting rainbow bridges it can move freely even through the earth and sea. Ancient Irismon's beauty and abilities were later passed on to the "Bird Man" and "Fairy Digimon".

name: Ceph Trooper
summary: The Ceph Trooper is a levitating robotic/mech infantry unit encountered by US and North Korean military forces on and around the Lingshan islands in August 2020. They are Ceph Stage 1 units and all originate from the Ceph Lithoship on the main Lingshan island. Although some have noted their insect-like appearance, their overall body plan also has some resemblance to Earth squid and octopus. The latter is far more likely, given the Ceph evolved from squid/octopus-like ancestors on their homeworld.

name: Kali (Supernatural)
summary: Kali was a Hindu Goddess and was one of many Deities who met to try to work out a way to stop the Apocalypse. Along with Baldur, she appeared to be one of the most- if not the most- powerful and oldest of the deities. She had previously had a relationship with Gabriel, when she thought he was the Trickster demigod Loki.

name: Elise (MadWorld)
summary: Elise is a Vampire and the #18 ranked combatant at the Death Watch Arena. She was once a little girl who visited the Mad Castle sanctuary, but an evil bat transformed her into what she is to this day. She is a natural fighter who prefers to fight her opponents head on rather than let her bats do all the work. She is later defeated by Jack Cayman, but her fate is left unknown.

name: Redeye
summary: Redeye is the main antagonists and final boss of H'aanit's story. Redeye was a beast who terrorized numerous people with the petrification stare. Z'aanta, H'aanit's mentor, was hired to kill the beast, but ended up as another one of the fell victims. H'aanit eventually comes across Redeye with a Herb-a-Grace in hand to avenge her mentor. She successfully kills the beast saving all of the petrified victims in the process including her mentor. Redeye was later revealed to be the tormented soul of Graham Crossford, who was then saved unknowingly by H'aanit.

name: White Bomberman
summary: White Bomberman is the main protagonist of the Bomberman series. He is the primary representative of the Bomberman people, who became the dominant inhabitants of Planet Bomber. Like all Bombermen, he has the ability to generate bombs in his hands. There are many incarnations of him represented in the different games of the series, which do not usually keep a consistent description of the character. He is often saving his home planet, the galaxy, or even the universe from disaster.

name: K.A.R.R
summary: KARR is an earlier model of KITT, abandoned for its dangerous behavior. It was kept in a warehouse until discovered by two criminals.

name: Cherrim
summary: Cherrim, the Blossom Pokémon, is sensible to sunlight to a notable degree, to the point it may change to it's Sunshine Form if exposed enough.

name: Mighty Liner
summary: Hikaru's trusty vessel, the Mighty Liner is a combat vehicle created with Peacelandian technology. To not give away that the Sakimori family were actually aliens, the vehicle was able to transform and appear as a normal Earth car. This allowed the vehicle to remain nearby at virtually all times, incognito. When needed to battle the Garoga aliens, though, it could transform into a versatile vehicle capable of flight, underwater travel and inter-dimensional dogfights.

name: Orisa
summary: Originally put into service before the Omnic Crisis, the OR14 "Idina" line of security robots was built in Nigeria's massive manufacturing omnium. After the war, they were taken out of production, along with many of the other models used during the Crisis. Twenty years later, Numbani revived and recommissioned the OR14 program to protect the city from external threats. These new OR15s were deployed for a short time before they were destroyed in an attack by Doomfist. Following the attack, the program was scrapped, and the civic government sold off the remaining OR15 inventory. Some parts were purchased by eleven-year-old Efi Oladele, a brilliant girl whose early accomplishments in robotics and artificial intelligence had already earned her the Adawe Foundation's prestigious "genius grant." With the approval of her understanding and open-minded parents, Efi spent the bulk of her grant money to acquire one of the decommissioned OR15 bots. She believed that Numbani needed a protector and that an upgraded OR15 could do just that. Efi repaired and reconfigured the robot and installed a personality core that she had designed herself. She named Numbani's newest hero Orisa.

name: The Journalist (Insurmountable)
summary: The Scientist is a mountain explorer who finds themselves documenting an island where time is looped, and forced to perform a series of particularly challenging and deadly expeditions to free themselves and return to civilization, after being rescued and recruited by The Adventurer.

name: Coral (Coral of the void)
summary: Coral of the void is the 38th holder of the void and the current leader of the void core. She lives with her human owner Cody and spends her time lazing around, causing chaos and defending her owner and the earth from monsters and eldritch abominations, such as the great old ones or even SCPs.

name: Taima no Kehaya
summary: Taima no Kehaya is a character from the Baki-Dou II manga series. His name means "to quickly kick out".

name: Shadow the Hedgehog (Game)
summary: Shadow the Hedgehog (シャドウ・ザ・ヘッジホッグ, Shadō za Hejjihoggu?) is an anthropomorphic hedgehog and recurring character that has appeared numerous times throughout the Sonic the Hedgehog video game series and its related media, debuting in 2001's Sonic Adventure 2 as the arch-rival of Sonic the Hedgehog and remaining that way since. He is a genetic hybrid between Hedgehog/Black Arms DNA created by Gerald Robotnik and the finalized result of Project Shadow (プロジェクトシャドウ, Purojekuto Shadō?), a government experiment of the United Federation aboard the Space Colony Ark that claimed to be achieving mankind's ultimate eternal dream; immortality. The truth was far more sinister; to use said results in order to create weapons of untold destruction. However, when G.U.N. boarded the Space Colony Ark and began slaughtering workers and civilians alike, Shadow would be launched to Earth in an escape pod at the cost of his dearest friend's life.

name: Cyrus
summary: Cyrus is the nihilistic main antagonist of the Sinnoh Pokémon games. He is the leader of Team Galactic and wishes to use the power of Palkia and Dialga to erase the universe, and remake it as a realm devoid of spirit.

name: Earl of Lemongrab (Original)
summary: Earl of Lemongrab is a recurring character in Adventure Time. He first appears in the episode Too Young. He is the high-strung, overly-zealous, obnoxious, stubborn ruler of the Earldom of Lemongrab, and the heir to the Candy Kingdom. It is possible that he is no longer heir to the throne because as of Hot Diggity Doom, the Candy Kingdom is now a democracy. He is the creation of Princess Bubblegum and the first of her experiments to go wrong. He was able to usurp the throne of the Candy Kingdom on the technicality of Bubblegum's de-aging. Once Princess Bubblegum was 18 again, she fires him, and he returns to Lemongrab.

name: The Scissorman (Bobby Barrows)
summary: Bobby Barrows is the primary stalker and secondary antagonist of Clock Tower: The First Fear. He is the first to assume the identity of the Scissorman, a recurring stalker villain of the Clock Tower series.

name: Sauron (Lego)
summary: Sauron was once a lieutenant to a greater Dark Lord, Melkor, renamed Morgoth, who was ultimately destroyed in the First Age, ending his rule in the North. Sauron, however, hid in the shadows unseen and discovered Mordor, to which he took advantage of its natural surroundings and chose it as his realm. He began to summon an army of Orcs through gruesome breeding and made alliances with the Easterlings, the Variags, the Corsairs of Umbar and the Haradrim.

name: Faceless (Fire Emblem)
summary: Faceless (Nosferatu in the Japanese version) are monsters created by Nohrian Dark Mages and Sorcerers and people can be turned into a Faceless by Anankos, they are brutal monsters that attack whoever they see when not under control, even their creator/summoner will be attacked. They were used by Nohr to pass through Queen Mikoto's barrier, which drains normal soldiers' will to fight. The main cast has claimed that they aren't much to them, yet they have shown to be dangerous multiple times.

name: Baba Yaga (Dungeons and Dragons)
summary: Baba Yaga is the progenitor to all hags and witches in any Dungeons and Dragons setting, and indeed is the cultivator and mentor to many of the finest arcane minds in the multiverse, including Iggwilv, whom she is the adopted mother of. Baba Yaga is constantly portrayed as an unpredictable hag of quite literally god-like power, feared by all for her inability to be analyzed or defeated. It is said Baba Yaga's Dancing Hut contains all manner of magic items, which she will give to adventurers whom she has chosen to allow to live- after impossible errands.

name: Kim the Invincible
summary: Kim (also known as Kim the Invincible) is a character from the Nickelodeon television series Kung Fu Panda: Legends of Awesomeness, serving as the main antagonist of the episode “Camp Ping”. He is a traveler who considers himself a hunter that challenges formidable warriors from all around the world, defeating them and rewarding himself with a new tattoo as memento, with his next and final memento reserved for the Dragon Warrior.

name: Nanashi (Shin Megami Tensei)
summary: Nanashi (lit. "Nameless") is the protagonist of Shin Megami Tensei IV Final. A member of the Hunter Association, he is killed during a mission, only to be resurrected by the mysterious demon Dagda. Due to circumstances seemingly unexplained, Nanashi is revived not as a human, but as something else: A Godslayer. Now, he walks a violent path, either with the goal of saving humanity from the Creator's tyranny, slaying him and bringing true freedom in the process, or to usurp the Creator's throne and rule in his place.

name: Lo Po Bia Dokoko
summary: Lo Po Bia Dokoko is the head of the Windbird branch of the Lo Po Bia Family.

name: Super Soldiers
summary: Super Soldiers (also known as D-Code or Orion Soldiers) are soldiers who have been genetically enhanced by Gentek with the three-week-old DX-1120 strain of the Blacklight Virus and the Mercer Virus.

name: Anji Mito
summary: Anji Mito (御津 闇慈, Mito Anji) is a character from the Guilty Gear series of fighting games. In the Guilty Gear universe he is one of the few Japanese survivors (the others being Baiken and May). For much of the story, he pursued the enigmatic That Man in order to confirm his theories about the origin of Gears, but he has recently been serving as Baiken's traveling companion since Happy Chaos was revealed to be the cause of Japan's destruction. He wields a powerful artifact called Zessen, which appears as two large hand fans, and incorporates traditional Japanese dance techniques into his fighting style.

name: Smithy
summary: Smithy is the main antagonist and final boss of Super Mario RPG: Legend of the Seven Stars and leader of the Smithy Gang, an organization that attempts to rule over Mario's World during the events of the game.

name: Kamen Rider Mad Rogue
summary: Nariaki Utsumi (内海 成彰 Utsumi Nariaki) is the former assistant of Gentoku Himuro at the Touto Institute of Advanced Matter Physics. He is a devoted member of the Namba Children and worked with Faust. After Gentoku's identity as a member of Faust was nearly blown, Nariaki acted as the decoy Night Rogue (ナイトローグ Naito Rōgu) during Touto's raid into Faust and was gunned down by Gentoku, presumed dead in the aftermath of the attack. He was however saved by Evolto and converted into a cyborg in order to save his life.

name: Knuckles the Echidna (Sonic X)
summary: Knuckles the Echidna (ナックルズ・ザ・エキドゥナ Nakkurusu za Ekiduna) is one of the main characters in the anime series Sonic X and its comic series published by Archie Comics. He is an anthropomorphic echidna, famous as a treasure hunter and a master of martial arts.

name: Spectrier
summary: Spectrier is a Legendary Ghost Type Pokémon who is native of the Galar Region. It used to be the Lord of the Crown Tundra, attacking with rage whoever enters in its territory, regardless of them being Pokémon or humans, until Calyrex came in and defeated it. From that day, Spectrier bonded with Calyrex and became its loyal steed.

name: Mitsurugi Meiya
summary: Mitsurugi Meiya is one of the main heroines in Muv-Luv, Muv-Luv Extra, and Muv-Luv Unlimited, as well as being one of the heroines in Muv-Luv Alternative.

name: Teddy (EarthBound Beginnings)
summary: Teddy was a main character in the NES Role-Playing Game Earthbound Beginnings (Also known as Earthbound Zero in older translations). He was the head of the Bla-Bla gang that terrorized the town of Ellay. At some point he challenged Ninten to a fight and was impressed by his skills so he decided to tag along.

name: Shou Toramaru
summary: Shou Toramaru (寅丸 星, Toramaru Shou) is a disciple of the god Bishamonten (毘沙門天). Along with Minamitsu Murasa and the other youkai aboard the Palanquin Ship, she seeks to revive Byakuren Hijiri after she had been sealed away in Makai by humans.

name: Ravager (RWBY)
summary: Ravagers are bat-like Creatures of Grimm that first appear in RWBY: After the Fall, where they are encountered by Team CFVY. They later appear in the main series at the end of "Worthy" attacking the refugees from Atlas and Mantle outside the main city of Vacuo.

name: Mia Cyrus
summary: Mia Cyrus was one of the 11 girls chosen to become magical girls to fight in what would later be called the Distonia War against the invading magical beast from the Spirit World. Holding the codename Just Cause, Mia was part of the Magical Five, the 5 surviving magical girls who defeated the king of the magic beasts during the final battle of the war. After said battle, Mia revealed her civilian identity to the public and officially joined the American forces Special Operations Division, though recently she has been conducting black ops with the CIA.

name: Cannon (Fairy Tail)
summary: Cannon is a member of Carbuncle who appears in Fairy Tail: Phoenix Priestess.

name: Senji Kiyomasa
summary: Kiyomasa Senji a.k.a Crow is a former police officer[1] and one of the major supporting characters in the series. He is also a Deadman previously imprisoned in Deadman Wonderland[2]. He uses his Branches of Sin to form blades extending from his forearms[3]. Enjoying a good fight, Senji supports Ganta after he defeats him in a fight in the Carnival Corpse[4]. He has trained Ganta and helped him on multiple occasions[5][6].

name: Giant Ant (The Godzilla Power Hour)
summary: The Giant Ants (巨大蟻, Kyodaiari?) are ant kaiju created by Hanna-Barbera that appeared in the 1979 Godzilla episode, "Valley of the Giants."

name: Hayato Suo
summary: Hayato Suo (蘇枋 隼飛, Suō Hayato?) is a first-year student at Furin High School, as well as a Grade Vice-Captain along with Akihiko Nirei.

name: Lora (Xenoblade)
summary: Lora is one of the main playable characters from Xenoblade Chronicles 2: Torna - The Golden Country.
abilities: Abilities
Resistances

name: Xefros Tritoh
summary: Xefros Tritoh is one of the main protagonists of the Homestuck video game Hiveswap. He is a rustblooded troll from the planet Alternia who is part of a revolution to overthrow the tyrannical caste-based government. He meets main protagonist Joey Claire after she gets swapped with Xefros' best friend Dammek and with her help manages to escape the destruction of his home town.

name: Remus Lupin
summary: Professor Remus John Lupin, also known as Moony, was a half-blood wizard and the only son of Lyall and Hope Lupin. He was afflicted with lycanthropy during his childhood, as Fenrir Greyback's revenge against Lyall. Professor of Defence Against the Dark Arts during the 1993-1994 school year. He was also a professor of Harry Potter, James's son, but resigned after Severus Snape revealed to the public that Remus was a werewolf. He fought against Death Eaters once more in the Second Wizarding War, during which he lost his friend Sirius. In 1997, Remus married fellow Order member Nymphadora Tonks and had a son, Edward Remus "Teddy" Lupin. Remus fought at the Battle of Hogwarts, during which his wife was murdered by Bellatrix Lestrange. Remus was also murdered by Death Eater, Antonin Dolohov, during the same battle in 1998.

name: Akron
summary: Akron is an Ancient Deity who lived for billions of years, before even life on Earth. He is an extremely mysterious and powerful entity who was draining the Earth of its energy and resources. Oddly enough, Akron was stated to be either created or summoned by Godcat herself, as a "gift to humanity". What she meant by this is unknown.

name: Joy Kill
summary: Joy Kill is the seventh boss enemy in Dark Deception, making their first appearance in Chapter 4 in the level "Mascot Mayhem". They're an amalgamation of the Joy Joy Gang members, assembled by Jocelyn after their original bodies were obliterated in a crusher.[1]

name: Tiplastico
categories: Xuxinha and Guto against the Space Monsters
summary: Tiplastico is the one of the antagonists in the movie: Xuxinha and Guto against the Space Monsters.[1]

name: Lityerses (Riordanverse)
summary: Lityerses is the demigod son of Midas and Demeter. He challenged people to harvesting contests and killed those who he defeated. He was finally killed by Hercules, but he came back through the Doors of Death. He later redeems himself after Apollo saved his life.

name: Beckett Hankwood
summary: Beckett Hawkwood is a minor antagonist in the James Bond Comics made by Dynamite Entertainment. He only shows up in the comic Eidolon. Beckett Hawkwood used to be a member of SPECTRE and the Secret Intelligence Service, however, when he gets hunted by Bond, he ends up killing himself so he could die unconnected to the crimes he has committed

name: Duke Ishamon Erisia
summary: Duke Ishamon Erisia, or simply Duke Erisia, is one of the main bosses that the Pathfinder will encounter

name: Metal Virus
summary: The Metal Virus is a biological weapon built by Dr. Eggman in the IDW Sonic Comics series.
abilities: Base
Mutated

name: Yayoi Itsushima
summary: Yayoi Itsushima is a malicious deity allied with Mithra. She thinks of Chisato as her sister, as they share a divine heritage, but the two are very different people, with Yayoi being an evil being who lures people into danger.

name: America Chavez (Marvel Cinematic Universe)
summary: America Chavez is a extra-dimensional being from the Utopian Parallel with the ability to travel the Multiverse using large, star-shaped portals. After manifesting her abilities, she became knowledgeable of different universes which she visited, also learning in the process that no alternate selves of her existed within the Multiverse. Chavez was later targeted by Scarlet Witch, who sought to acquire her powers, leading to her being relentlessly hunted down by inter-dimensional creatures and monsters. Believing she could defeat her enemies with the Book of Vishanti, she took up the help of Doctor Strange, until he betrayed her. Using a portal, she escaped to another universe, where she was rescued by another Doctor Strange. Chavez and Strange continued to elude Scarlet Witch through different universes and searched for the book, however, they were arrested by the Illuminati in the process; their quest fell futile when Scarlet Witch destroyed the book and abducted Chavez. Strange was able to rescue Chavez before the Scarlet Witch was able to absorb her powers. In the aftermath, Chavez joined the ranks of the Masters of the Mystic Arts.

name: Superman (Rebirth)
summary: Superman, also known as Clark Kent and Kal-El, is a Kryptonian superhero. Though born of the planet Krypton, he was sent away in a spaceship as a baby to save him from his home planet's destruction. His spaceship landed on Earth in Smallville, Kansas where he was found and adopted by Jonathan and Martha Kent. Raised to a high moral standard, Superman uses his powers to protect innocents and safeguard his adopted home. He is husband to Lois Lane and the father of Superboy.

name: Trent Fernandez-Mercer
summary: Trent Fernandez-Mercer is the White Dino Thunder Ranger, who was initially corrupted by the White Dino Gem but then reformed when the evil was removed from him by his adopted father, Dr. Anton Mercer. When his biological parents were killed in an archaeological cave-in, Dr. Mercer took him in, though he still kept his original surname. He works at Hayley's Cyberspace as a waiter and draws in his spare time, though he keeps this secret because his father does not approve of his artistic endeavours.

name: Jessica Drew (Spider-Verse)
summary: Jessica Drew or known as Spider-Woman is one of the supporting characters in Across the Spiderverse. She had gone through the same canon events other Spider-people have. She then married at some point in her life. More towards the time-lapse of the first two Spiderverse movies, she gained membership and a large role in the Spider society that is led by Miguel. In Across the Spiderverse, she is seen to be pregnant, and in a mission to catch an anomaly in the Earth-65 dimension she meets with Gwen. She is impressed by Gwen, wanting to take her into the Spider society, much to Miguel's antagonizing opposition towards it. This is until Gwen expresses her inability to fix things in her dimension that Miguel allows her to join.

name: Hannibal King (Marvel Comics)
summary: Hannibal King used to be a relatively normal private investigator, until the day one job he was given brought him too close to a man far more dangerous than he could ever imagine: Deacon Frost, the same vampire who killed Blade's mother at the moment of his birth, bit Hannibal King, turning him into yet another member of the blood-drinking horde.

name: Yusuke Urameshi
summary: Yusuke Urameshi is the main protagonist of the manga & anime series Yu Yu Hakusho.

name: Vandal Savage (DCAU)
summary: Vandal Savage, originally Vandar Adg during the age he was born in, was an immortal Metahuman who lusted for power and fought the Justice League for it.

name: Mandy Luxe
summary: Mandy Luxe is a spoiled, egotistical and unpleasant girl who is frequently a rival to Sam, Alex, and Clover when not in their spy duties. Despite not having any megalomaniacal scheme to destroy WOOHP (yet, anyways), she still manages to bring ruin and frustration to their lives far more effectively than any villain ever could.

name: Tenebria (Gravity Rush)
summary: Tenebria is a character in Another Story - Raven's Choice. She is the physical form of the element of darkness that, along with Lumino, fled to Illumina after escaping from the Ark.

name: Hatchet Face
summary: Hatchet Face triggered and got his powers when he was maimed by a Parahuman, and announced his existence by killing a superhero during a live interview as part of a vendetta. He was talked into joining the Slaughterhouse Nine, a team of highly dangerous supervillains and an S-class threat, by Jack Slash, who convinced him he could kill more Parahumans as a member than by himself.

name: Periwrinkle (Ninjago)
summary: Periwrinkle is the daughter of a magician named Mindaro. She is a mysterious young woman who invites Wu and Garmadon to stay. Peri is willing to share her food, her home, and her paintings, but is reluctant to tell the ninja where the rest of her family is, until the brothers get stuck inside one of her paintings.

name: Mash
categories: The Hero is Overpowered but Overly Cautious
summary: Mash is a warrior-class Dragonkin (half human, half dragon) who was given the role of Seiya's bag-carrier. He had initially came to Seiya's aid along with his sister Elulu. Upon returning to his homeland, Mash was granted the power of Dragon Metamorphosis by his mother Leviae.

name: Juzo Mido (Code Vein)
summary: Juzo Mido was an acclaimed scientist and researcher; one of the top in his field from well before the Great Collapse. However, under the guise of revolutionary scientific research, Juzo Mido attempted many malicious and vile experiments, involving a program to create "enhanced soldiers" that resulted in him kidnapping and enslaving many children including Yakumo Shinonome. Under the belief that humans are being held back from their true potential, and in the interest of "rising people to the next step in evolution", he continued these experiments until well after the Great Collapse within the Gaol of the Mists and took advantage of many humans and revenants to push the limits of human potential.

name: Drakaina (Shadow Fight)
summary: Drakaina is the ninth Eternal encountered in the Underworld, the multiplayer mode of Shadow Fight 2. She is one of the three bosses of the third and final floor of the Underworld, along with her brother, Karcer, and her father, Tenebris. She makes her first appearance after Shadow defeats Karcer and advances forward into the heart of the Underworld, ending up in her dungeon. She claims that every battle in the world is like a gift on her altar, and Sensei informs Shadow that she has a boiling thirst for blood and is full of rage, her main goal being to delight herself in an endless battle. Even after Shadow defeats her once in combat, she still doesn't feel exhausted at all and challenges him again to a fight. She represents the concept of war and is one of Tenebris' creations.

name: Zatanna (Justice League Action)
summary: Zatanna is a stage magician who hosts her own magic shows on the streets of Gotham. She assists the Justice League whenever they need help with supernatural conundrums.

name: Living Statue of Poseidon
summary: The Living Statue of Poseidon is a great statue of the God of the Seas which is animated by Poseidon himself, having been seduced by the King of the Titans, Kronos, and the other Titans, for a shot at becoming King of the Gods, to aid Gargarensis in the release pf the Titans from Tartarus in the final mission of the Fall of the Trident campaign.

name: Gazel Dwargo (Web Novel)
summary: Gazel Dwargo is the third generation king of Dwargon. He is renowned as a great hero and celebrated as a wise king for his impartial rule.

name: Kamen Rider Kenzan
summary: Ren Akamichi (緋道 蓮, Akamichi Ren) is a hot-blooded and short-tempered swordsman who has an obsession with strength. Due to his master's training, strength is the only thing that drives Ren and he will go to the extreme to achieve it. This desire for strength granted him the Fuusouken Hayate to become Kamen Rider Kenzan. He eventually formed an unstable alliance with Desast, a defected Megid, so they can both find what they have been looking for their whole lives. This led Ren to find his strength his own way. By the last 2 arcs of the show, Ren has significantly calmed down.

name: Beavis
summary: Beavis is one of the two protagonists of the MTV animated series, Beavis and Butt-Head. He is the best friend of Butt-Head and is notorious for being aggressive and hostile in contrast to his friend's more levelheaded attitude.

name: Jorah Mormont (A Song of Ice and Fire)
categories: A Song of Ice and Fire
summary: Ser Jorah Mormont is an exiled knight, the former head of House Mormont, and Lord of Bear Island. He fled Westeros to escape execution for trading in slaves and took up work as a mercenary in the Free Cities, eventually entering the service of the last Targaryens. He becomes one of the most trusted companions of Daenerys Targaryen.

name: General Rilldo
summary: General Rilldo (リルド将軍) is a Machine Mutant antagonist in the anime Dragon Ball GT. He is Dr. Myuu's general, as well as the commander of planet M-2.

name: The Shadow (Amnesia)
summary: The Shadow is an invisible, untouchable force that lingers over Daniel during the events of Amnesia: The Dark Descent. While its intentions are unknown, it is an ancient being that protects the Orbs, many theorizing that it is the Universe attempting to prevent one from utilizing the orbs to escape into another dimension. During the events of the game, the Shadow follows Daniel, especially at times of low sanity, until the end of the game, where it either consumes him if Alexander's ritual is completed or spares him and consumes Alexander if he disrupts the ritual.

name: Mr. Boss (Smiling Friends)
summary: Mr. Boss is the fifth main character of Smiling Friends. He is generally the character who sends Pim and Charlie on their missions to make people smile.
abilities: Superhuman Physical Characteristics

Weapon Mastery ( Implied to have assassinated Mr. Frog or at the very least seemed confident he could [ 2 ] . Could do motion capture stunts for a video game which involved using a cane as a weapon [ 2 ] )

Multiple Selves ( Type 1; Has full conversations with himself in the mirror, even trying to attack his reflection and having huge disagreements [ 3 ] ) Sound Manipulation (His voice also appears to change when his alternate personality is talking [ 4 ] )
