name: Dino (Michael Bay)
summary: A vigorous warrior, Dino (Or Mirage) is always among the first on the battlefield thanks to his impatience. His peers would call him either bold or reckless, depending on who you ask.

name: Harley (Final Fantasy)
summary: Harley is the secretary of the Kingdom of Damcyan and one of the protagonists of Final Fantasy IV: The After Years. During an inspection on one of the fallen meteors from the True Moon, her king suspects Baron is up to no good, and inspects on Cecil to see if everything's ok. Before he parted ways with Baron, King Edward left a whisperweed in his room and confirms that Cecil's working with the Maenads to retrieve the crystals from the planet, but are unsure why they're doing this. After an encounter with Kain's dark reflection, Edward decides to aid the rest of the kingdoms, with Harleyt at his side, to stop the Maenads and the forces from the True Moon from gaining the Crystals from their home.

name: Chieri
summary: Chieri Oomine is one of the two main characters in Chieri's Love Is 8 Meters.

name: Mike Wheeler
summary: When Mike's best friend, Will Byers, mysteriously went missing, he and his other friends, Lucas and Dustin, made it their mission to find him. However, while searching for Will, they stumbled upon an escaped girl named Eleven instead. Mike soon discovered that she knew something about Will's disappearance and enlisted her help in finding him. During their time together, Mike and Eleven formed a strong bond and quickly grew to like each other. Once Will was found, Mike was happy that he had returned home safely; however, he was greatly devastated by Eleven's sacrifice to defeat the Demogorgon.

name: Mithra (Psyren)
summary: Mithra is the hidden point behind all of W.I.S.E's schemes. Her plan to use Miroku in order to prepare the planet to be destroyed by Quat Nevas was foiled when Ageha Yoshina revealed her true intentions. In the future timeline, Miroku and Grana destroyed Quat Nevas at the cost of their lives. In the present timeline, Mithra partially merged with Oroboros, but was ultimately defeated by the combined efforts of Miroku and Ageha.

name: Hedorah
summary: Hedorah (ヘドラ) is an alien pollution kaiju created by Toho that first faced Godzilla in the 1971 Godzilla film, Godzilla vs Hedorah.

name: Reize Seatlan
summary: Reize Seatlan is a minor character found in Shovel of Hope, and is one of the wandering bosses that can be encountered as Shovel Knight travels from level to level. He's a naive adventurer who fights for justice, only fighting Shovel Knight due to mistaking him for The Black Knight.

name: Bullseye (Marvel Comics)
summary: The man known only as Lester once aimed to become a Major League Baseball player with his immense throwing skill, but his personality led to the game quickly becoming boring for him. Thus, he instead decided to use his talent to become the mercenary assassin Bullseye.
abilities: Classic
Marvel NOW!
The End of Hell

name: Kimahri Ronso
summary: Kimahri Ronso is one of the main party members of Final Fantasy X. Like all Ronso youth, Kimahri trained endlessly to become strong enough to defend and lead his tribe, but his comparatively diminutive stature caused him to be bullied even when came of age. He would constantly challenge fellow Ronso, Biran, never giving up even after losing every single encounter. Angered, this prompted Biran to break Kimahri's horn, causing Kimahri to leave his village in disgrace.

name: Shuro Chi
summary: Shuro Chi is an Awoken Techeun, or Tech Witch, who serves the Queen of the Reef, Mara Sov. She has been a close aid of the Queen for centuries, already being active during the Reef Wars. Together with the other Techeuns, Shuro Chi invented various creations in service of Mara Sov's plans, such as the Blind Well and the Wall of Wishes. At the start of the Taken War, she was one of the three Techeuns who attacked the fleet of Oryx, the Taken King with their Harbingers. However, the Dreadnaught's superweapon was able to follow Shuro Chi through the portal she used to escaped, leading Oryx to the Dreaming City. As a result she got Taken, becoming Shuro Chi, the Corrupted.

name: Hermelina
summary: Hermelina is one of the humans that regularly cross to the parallel world of Ground's Nir. One of Beatrice's friends who regularly teams up with her to go into the Labyrinth, Hermelina is also considered a monster at the level cap.

name: Khonsu (Worm)
summary: Khonsu is the fourth Endbringer to make an appearance in Worm, emerging on January 20, 2012. Unlike the other Endbringers, his attacks are indiscriminate, due to his tendency to teleport to locations across the entire planet as he spreads carnage in his wake.

name: The Spire
summary: Blighting the world around it, The Spire is a mysterious structure that looms over the lands, inviting many adventurers to attempt to climb it to slay its heart, but to no avail.

name: Chuck (Panty & Stocking)
summary: Chuck is a character in Panty & Stocking with Garterbelt. He is Panty and Stocking's pet sidekick. He resembles a green dog with zippers for ears and a tail. Chuck is subjected to various injuries throughout the series but is able to recover extremely quickly. Panty and Stocking in particular regularly 'kill' him without even breaking the pace of their current situation, and often take out their frustration on him with the knowledge that nothing will really affect him. Aside from being a convenient punching bag, he is also often used as a sort of mailbox by Heaven, getting struck by lightning and spitting out a clue to a ghost's whereabouts. In addition, he has been shown to be capable of driving the Anarchy sisters' car, a roofless pink Hummer H1 called See Through. He is endowed with a more formidable power as well: by turning himself inside-out with his zippers, Chuck has the ability to transform into a colossal horned hellhound. In this form, he can still regenerate from infinite amounts of abuse and shoot giant fire blasts powerful enough to take out the powered-up form of his counterpart Fastener. He can also transform himself into a giant zipper that can seal Hell's Gate.

name: Vulture (Marvel Cinematic Universe)
summary: Adrian Toomes, also known as Vulture, is the former owner of Toomes Salvage Company, based inside New York City, who was forced to turn to a criminal lifestyle after his livelihood was usurped by the Department of Damage Control, a joint venture between the federal government and Tony Stark.

name: Seth Rollins (WWE)
summary: Seth Rollins (May 28, 1986) is an American professional wrestler, signed to World Wrestling Entertainment (WWE) on the Raw brand. He is a two-time WWE Universal Champion, a two-time WWE Champion, six-time WWE Raw Tag Team Champion, two-time WWE Intercontinental Champion, the inaugural NXT Champion, two-time WWE United States Champion and the current World Heavyweight Champion.

name: Dante (DMC Reboot)
summary: The main character of "DmC: Devil May Cry", the Devil May Cry reboot, Dante is the son of a demon named Sparda and an angel named Eva. Dante grew up in various institutions, orphanages, youth correction facilities, and foster homes, but these were mostly operated by demons, and often resulted in torture and violence. Now he fights to rid Limbo City of the corruption and control of the demons responsible for the human population's manipulation.

name: Cook
summary: The Old Man, The Cook. He might say he "don't take much pleasure in killing" but he does just fine when needed. He's the owner of the gas station and the order of the household, what little order there is, and knows every inch of these places. One board creaks and he can pin down its location.

name: Qetsiyah
summary: Qetsiyah (Ancient Greek: Θετσιψαη, Hebrew: קעצייאַה, Arabic: كاتسيا, Syriac: ܩeܬܣiܝܐܗ; translates as "cassia"), known in modern times as Tessa, was the most powerful witch of the Traveler subculture, as well as "one of the most powerful witches of all time". Qetsiyah is best known for creating the first Immortality Spell, and subsequently the first Immortal, as well as the only cure for it, and the supernatural purgatory known as the Other Side. Qetsiyah was engaged to another witch named Silas, with whom she was madly in love. At his request, Qetsiyah concocted an immortality elixir that she had planned to share with him as a part of their wedding ceremony. However, after Silas betrayed Qetsiyah by taking the potion with her handmaiden, Amara, and soulmate, Qetsiyah retaliated by kidnapping Amara, and using her eternal and indestructible body to bind the spell that created the Other Side. Deceived into believing that Amara was dead, Silas was later imprisoned deep within a remote cave, along with the cure to his immortality. She believed that Silas would eventually take the cure and die as a mortal, thus joining her on the Other Side; Qetsiyah would spend the next two millenia in her own purgatory.

name: Zebruh Codakk
summary: Zebruh Codakk is a befriendable character in the visual novel Hiveswap Friendsim, appearing in Volumes 5, 8, and 16. He is a wealthy indigoblooded troll that lives in a giant mansion with his lusus, a zebra, as well as a few lowblood servants. He is overly flirtatious, if not downright perverted at times, and has an occupation as a prominent music reviewer, and in one bad ending, a nightclub owner. In Volume 5, the player meets him on Flushed Affirmations Day, his planet's equivalent of Valentine's Day, as he brings them back to his mansion and attempts to make advances on them.

name: Zeyen (Granblue Fantasy)
summary: The current holder of the name of Zeyen and the elder of Kluger Island. He's also known as the Omniscient Sage by the inhabitants of other islands. As the keeper of Kluger Island's many teachings, he can use the power of the resident primal beast Antikythera to calculate the nature of countless possible futures. He passes the teachings down orally, only sharing his power with the chosen. [1]

name: Gilgamesh (Final Fantasy XV)
summary: Gilgamesh, contrarily known as the Blademaster, is an antagonist and the final boss of Final Fantasy XV: Episode Gladiolus. Gilgamesh is the Shield of the Founder King from over 2,000 years ago and is the one who judges those as worthy or unworthy of defending the True King.

name: Suzuki (Bouncer)
summary: Suzuki is a minor character in Bouncer. He is a one of the animal masked characters known for wearing the dog mask.

name: Kidou Yuuto
summary: Kidou Yuuto, or Jude Sharp, is one of the main characters of Inazuma Eleven, initially the captain of Teikoku Gakuen, he later joins Raimon as their playmaker. He plays in the Midfielder position as the genius playmaker of the team, consistently leading the charge on tactics and commands. Kidou and his sister Haruna had lost their parents when they were young to a plane crash, left only with a soccer magazine as his only connection to them. With his talent for soccer, he was found by Kageyama Reiji who recommended his adoption into fortune by the Kidou Financial Group; made him captain of Teikoku Gakuen and groomed him into his perfect successor.

name: Scarecrow (Dungeons and Dragons)
summary: A type of Golem, a Scarecrow is made via binding an evil soul to a regular scarecrow which gives it supernatural abilities like a gaze that can strike fear into people.

name: Godzilla (Godzilla: Oblivion)
summary: Godzilla is the dominate monster of a parallel Earth, preventing other monsters from growing to full size due to his dominance. He was eventually summoned to stop King Ghidorah from destroying the planet. He successfully defeated him, but then terrorized the Earth himself.

name: Kōmori Maniwa
summary: The first opponent faced by Shichika Yasuri in his quest to collect the Twelve Deviant Blades, Kōmori Maniwa is one of the twelve heads of the Maniwa Ninja Corps, and a member of the Beast Squad, working under Kawauso Maniwa. Themed after a bat, he possesses shapeshifting capabilities and an arrogant personality, as well as wielding Zettou Kanna.

name: Servantis
summary: Servantis is the leader of the Rooters and a former Proctor-ranked Plumber. He was the mastermind behind the Rooters conspiracy, and the one who planted Devin Levin and Ragnarok in Max's memory in order to capture Ben Tennyson.

name: Time Demon
summary: The Time Demon is a mystical creature with power over the flow of time. It locked itself in a labyrinth in order to keep anyone from abusing its ability. In order to save themselves from a time loop, Akko and her friends encounter and battle it in order to prove their worth and have their wish granted.

name: Good Luck Bear (Original)
summary: Good Luck Bear is one of the ten original Care Bears who first appeared on American Greetings greeting cards in late 1982. Good Luck is a fortuitous bear that never seems to run out of good luck. However, this has just as much to do with his exceptionally bright, positive outlook on life as it does with his ability to create his own four-leaf clovers. Truly believing that there is no such thing as "bad luck", the fortunate fellow tries to help others by improving the power of their own self-confidence and removing all doubt from their heart.

name: Giant Squid (Spellstone)
summary: Giant Squid is a Epic Wyld Seafolk creature from Spellstone. It is a squid creature shown to be larger than a sperm whale, much bigger than a real life giant squid. It's Dual Fusion is Hulking Squid, and it's Quad Fusion is Monstrous Squid.

name: Chojuro Kon (Chimera)
summary: Chojuro Kon (今こん鳥ちょう獣じゅう郎ろう Kon Chojuro), also known as Chimera (キメラ Kimera), is a villain working with Nine in the film My Hero Academia: Heroes Rising.

name: Ruri Hijiribe
summary: Ruri Hijiribe is a popular celebrity in Durarara!!. After her family went broke following the collapse of the family business, Ruri became a makeup artist, as she was a huge fan of monster movies and slasher films. She later became a popular idol, starting out as a model for cosmetic products before moving on to show business.

name: Rush (Demon Rush)
summary: Rush is an ally of Lucifer that is bent on destroying all the remaining Angels and Holy Knights in order to close the Heavenly Ream once and for all.

name: Stalker (Attack of the Earthlings)
summary: The Stalker is one of the main Swarmer units in Attack of the Earthlings.

name: Dauntless
summary: Dauntless was a hero in Brockton Bay who had the ability to empower objects in his possession. A rising star within the Protectorate, Dauntless was on track to eventually match and even surpass Earth's greatest heroes, before his life was seemingly cut short when Leviathan threw him into a bubble of stopped time.

name: Josh Birk
summary: Josh Birk is an actor who tags along with the 3rd Street Saints to study the gang's behavior in order for him to make his role in an upcoming movie based on the gang's adventures convincing. He is well-known for his role as Nyte Blayde in a TV show of the same name about a vampire hunter-turned-vampire, who is hunted by an organization he once worked for.

name: Amora the Enchantress (Avengers Assemble)
summary: Amora the Enchantress is an Asgardian sorceress, supervillain and a member of the new Cabal. She is one of Thor's enemies. She is a major antagonist of Season 4: Secret Wars.

name: Karina
summary: Karina was once the princess of a faraway kingdom who grew more and more weary of the monotony of the royal lifestyle, until her 14th birthday when she fled her castle and was almost immediately captured by a crew of pirates who planned to hold her for ransom. To their surprise, she asked to join their crew, and after a tussle with the captain of the ship, she won and soon became the captain of the crew. Several years later, she arrived at the Halidom and decided to fight alongside Euden after seeing the bright light of conviction in his eyes. Despite her fierce persona on the battlefield and her seemingly rough exterior, she is a very kind and considerate person who treats everyone with the respect she feels is due.

name: Kamen Rider Cross-Z Build
summary: Cross-Z Build Form (クローズビルドフォーム Kurōzu Birudo Fōmu) is Build's fusion form, combining the powers of Build and Cross-Z and fusing Sento and Ryuga into one body. It is accessed using the Cross-ZBuild Can, a transfusion of the Genius Fullbottle with Gold Rabbit and Silver Dragon Fullbottles.

name: Marsmon
summary: Marsmon is a member of the enigmatic "Olympos XII", it is a Digimon god of war with the appearance of a panther-man. The Olympos XII lie in the shadows and possess ability rivaling that of the guardian deities of the Net, the "Royal Knights", and each protects its own domain while maintaining a position of neutrality regarding the incidents which arise in the Digital World. Marsmon is well-versed in all sorts of combat techniques known throughout the world, including underhanded techniques, and has absolute confidence in battles against others in the same weight class. While Marsmon typically uses wrestling techniques, it is so fixated on victory and glory that when push comes to shove, it will not hesitate to use concealed weapons such as its "Tria Knuckle" or "Metal Cothurnus". However, its true power is exhibited when it uses its bare hands and feet.

name: Soelma Nilaenish
summary: Soelma Nilaenish is an ancient and scholarly elf woman who became a wizard and loremaster. After her guardian, an aunt, died, she was left alone from the young age of 196. Throughout her life she has studied much and seen all, leaving her reclusive but highly intelligent. She is considered extraordinary among scholars in her fields.

name: Spec
summary: Spec is an escaped American convict who was one of several primary antagonists during the events of the Most Evil Death Row Convicts Saga in the second installation of the Grappler Baki, New Grappler Baki. He is a sadistic and violent serial killer who is classified alongside four other convicts as the most dangerous and powerful criminals on Earth.

name: Captain Linger
summary: Captain Linger is the eponymous main character of a series of shorts aired on Adult Swim. He is a parody character: A superhero who, despite being highly effective at solving problems, has a very awkward demeanor.

name: Ketheric Thorm
summary: Ketheric Thorm has been many things: a father to his daughter and husband to his wife, both taken before their time. A devoted follower of the Gods- first Selune, when he walked in her light, and then Shar when only the darkness could soothe him, and finally Myrkul, when all he wanted was death. At every turn of his life, despair and loss tore away another piece of him until only the shell remained. That, too, was to be the plaything of the gods, for Ketheric Thorm was unbreakable.
abilities: Follower of Selune
Follower of Shar
Follower of Myrkul

name: Thanos (Marvel Cinematic Universe)
summary: Thanos, referred to as the Dark Lord by his most loyal underlings and the Mad Titan by the galactic community, is a powerful Titan warlord who rules over a distant region of space and commands two massive armies, known as the Chitauri and the Outriders, and a small group of followers known as the Black Order whom he adopted as his children. His main objective was to bring stability from the universe, as he believed its massive population would inevitably use up the universe's resources and condemn it. However, his methodology to succeed was warped; through the use of the ancient Infinity Stones, he intended to harness their power to exterminate half of all life in the universe, thus returning it to what he perceived to be a state of cosmic balance.

name: Yggdrasil (Skul: The Hero Slayer)
summary: Elder Ent: Yggdrasil is the stage boss for the Forest of Harmony. It is a massive and ancient Ent that is corrupted by dark quartz.

name: Mothra Leo
summary: Mothra Leo (新モスラ, Shin Mosura?, lit. New Mothra) is a giant divine moth kaiju who first appeared in the 1996 Toho film, Rebirth of Mothra.
abilities: Larval
Imago

name: Elias Hackblade
summary: Elias Hackblade is a Blademancer-Ancient Elf Lander and the "hero" of Elder Tale lore. After the Catastrophe, he was nearly sealed and killed by the Genius, when Kanami arrived and saved him, prompting him to join her on her journey to Japan in order to find out what happened to the rest of the Ancients.

name: Harumi Shidow
summary: Harumi Shidow is one of the antagonists of Fukashigi Philia. Harumi is one of the "villains" created by Noa and Isumi Yuunagi by taking corpses and resurrecting them.

name: Anankos
summary: Anankos (ハイドラ Hydra) is the main antagonist and final boss in Fire Emblem: Fates' true ending.

name: Akura Charity
summary: Akura Charity is one of the three pillars of the Akura Clan and the aunt of Akura Mercy. As a Sage with a connection to the Heart Icon who has serves under her grandmother Akura Malice, Charity is distinguished, well mannered and in complete control of her emotions at all time. Although initially introduced with reason to have disdain for Lindon she recognized his talent in the Sacred Arts and was quick to put him to work for the Akura clan by selecting him to represent them in the Uncrowned Tournament.

name: Lucy Kuo
summary: Lucy Kuo was an undercover agent working for the NSA to investigate the organization known as the First Sons, stationed at New Marais while working with an inside man, Dr. Sebastian Wolfe. Afterwards, experimentation performed on her activated Kuo's Conduit abilities, causing her to be able to manipulate ice and fly.

name: Shinji Ikari
summary: Shinji Ikari (碇 シンジ Ikari Shinji) is the Third Children, the main protagonist of the Neon Genesis Evangelion series and the designated pilot of Evangelion Unit-01. He is the son of the "deceased" Gehirn bioengineer Yui Ikari and NERV Commander Gendo Ikari. After his mother's death, he was abandoned by his father and lived for 11 years with his sensei, until he was summoned to Tokyo-3 to pilot Unit-01 against the Angels. He lives initially just with Misato Katsuragi; they are later joined by Asuka Langley Sohryu.
abilities: Casual
Plugsuit (01)

name: Juda
summary: Juda was the youngest of the Guar siblings and one of the three leader of the Guar Army along side his brother, Mold, and sister, Gina. Juda and his family serve as the main villains of the Andro Melos manga series as well as in the Andro Melos TV miniseries. Juda later appears solo as the main villain of the film, Ultraman Story. In Ultra Fight Victory, he was revived by Yapool as Juda Spectre.

name: Yuuma Toutetsu
summary: Yuuma Toutetsu (饕餮 尤魔 Toutetsu Yuuma) is the leader of the Gouyoku Alliance under which the eagle spirits serve. She was originally mentioned by Saki Kurokoma in the extra stage of Wily Beast and Weakest Creature, before appearing as the primary antagonist of Gouyoku Ibun.

name: Death (Dante's Inferno)
summary: Death is a major antagonist in the video game Dante's Inferno, in which he functioned as the first boss.

name: Trigger Finger
summary: Trigger Finger is the memory of the neuron that send the input to pull the trigger in a failed rockstar's suicide. Seeking to repent in the world created by his panicking subconscious, it accompanies Static in its search for a miracle.

name: The Plague Doctor (Darkest Dungeon)
summary: The Plague Doctor is a scholar and a scientist, and carries her research's fruits into the battlefield, using them to poison her foes and heal her allies.

name: Rammus
summary: Idolized by many, dismissed by some, and mystifying to all, the curious being, Rammus, is an enigma. Protected by a spiked shell, Rammus inspires increasingly disparate theories on his origin wherever he goes - from demigod, to sacred oracle, to a mere beast transformed by magic. Whatever the truth may be, Rammus keeps his own counsel and stops for no one as he roams the desert.

name: Ma Liang (Shen Bi Ma Liang)
summary: Ma Liang (马良) is the main protagonist of the 1950s Chinese children book Shen Bi Ma Liang (神笔马良, lit. Ma Liang with the Magical Pen) created by Hong Xuntao and his story eventually became movies by the Shanghai Animation Film Studio.

name: Wilhelm (Borderlands)
summary: Wilhelm was a Vault Hunter and is one of Handsome Jack's most powerful subordinates. A mercenary with enough kills to populate a small country, he is obsessed with cybernetic enhancements, entering Jack's service for a few million dollars and the chance to obtain more cybernetic parts.

name: Li Xingwen
summary: Li Xingwen is the Grand Supreme Elder of the Ethereal Dao College and the first and former president of the Federation. He is the first cultivator to reach Foundation Establishment, the first to reach Core Formation and the first to reach Nascent Soul in the entire Federation. In addition to this, he is among the first people to establish a connection with the Vast Expanse Dao Palace within the sword piercing the Sun. He has romantic feelings for one of their Grand Elders.

name: Scrooge McDuck (1987)
summary: Scrooge McDuck is the main protagonist of Disney's 1987 animated television series DuckTales and other media that happened on it's continuity. He is a head-strong, penny-pinching Scottish duck who resides at his manor in Duckburg, the richest duck in the world, the uncle of Donald Duck and the loving great-uncle of his nephews Huey, Dewey, and Louie.

name: Simosuchus
summary: Simosuchus is a genus of notosuchian crocodyliform with the single species S. clarki. It's name means is Greek for "pug nosed crocodile," referring to is blunt snout akin the beloved dog breed. It lived 70–66 million years ago, during the late Cretaceous, in present day Madagascar. Unlike many other crocodylomorphs, its characteristics, such as maple leaf shaped teeth, indicate it was herbivorous.

name: Vegeta (Toei)
summary: Vegeta (ベジータ, Bejīta?) is the disgraced prince of the Saiyan race, one of the few survivors of his species after Frieza destroyed Planet Vegeta. Left with no choice but to follow his orders, Vegeta travelled across the galaxy and eradicated planets for sale before he was brought to Earth by Raditz's report of the Dragon Balls, a magical set of balls that could grant him immortality. Upon arriving on Earth, he ultimately comes to encounter and fights Son Goku, the man who would go on to become his greatest rival.
abilities: Saiyan Arc
Frieza Arc

Regular Design

name: Kanata Amane
summary: Kanata Amane is an angel girl from the Celestial Academy. She's still in training and is currently studying the art of healing people. Perhaps as a way to hide her shyness, Kanata tries to act cool or pull pranks on others, backed-up by a slight sadistic streak... but her rate of success is limited. Atypical from the expectations one may have of an angel, Kanata has monstrous physical strength, a heated temper, has a knack for violence, her anger often blows up and she rarely shows angelic attributes. Her wings are detachable, but doing so causes her intense pain.

name: Buck Hughes
summary: Bambi "Buck" Hughes is a major antagonist in the 2012 video game Far Cry 3. He served as the main antagonist at the mid of the game.

name: Sonic the Hedgehog (Archie Post-Genesis Wave)
summary: Sonic the Hedgehog is a hedgehog gifted with the power of super-sonic speed, and the ability to control the power of the Chaos Emeralds. Considered by many to be the hero of the world, he has opposed the villainous reign of the evil Dr. Eggman and his Eggman Empire since his early childhood. Sonic's speed is his ultimate weapon, and he has used it to help those in need, as well as foil his enemies' plans. Although he is sometimes overconfident and assumes he can deal with things on his own, Sonic also realizes he has friends to back him up in troubled situations. Sonic is clever which allows him to have ways to foil villains plans. The primary field agent of the Knothole Freedom Fighters, he is willing to put his life on the line for those he cares about.

name: Billy Bob (Beavis and Butthead)
summary: Billy Bob is a minor character from Beavis and Butthead, a morbidly obese hillbilly with six coronary bypasses. He is extremely fast and strong despite his health problems, and will fly into a rage if his scooter is stolen. He also owns a shooting skeet.

name: Terumasa Nanjo
summary: Terumasa Nanjo is a character in Umineko no Naku Koro Ni. He is one of the 18 humans on Rokkenjima.

name: Booker DeWitt
summary: Booker DeWitt is the protagonist of BioShock Infinite. He is a private investigator and, prior to his reluctant arrival in Columbia, a former soldier and Pinkerton agent. Booker is offered a deal to wipe away his debts if he goes to Columbia and retrieves a girl imprisoned there.
abilities: Vigors
Vigor Combos
Shield: A passive Vigor, a self-recharging magnetic-repulsive field that acts as a full body defensive barrier
Bucking Bronco: Temporarily levitates enemies, rendering them defenseless. Charged effect deploys the Vigor as a stationary trap, levitating nearby enemies for longer when sprung.
Charge: Causes Booker to ram into the target from a distance and damage them. Charged effect increases the charge's damage the longer the Vigor is held.

Devil's Kiss: Throws a flaming projectile which detonates after a short while, burning nearby enemies and environmental hazards. Charged effect deploys the Vigor as a stationary trap, exploding and burning surrounding enemies for higher damage when sprung.

Murder of Crows: Summons a murder of crows onto the targeted enemies, damaging and temporarily distracting them. Charged effect deploys the Vigor as a stationary trap, releasing crows onto all nearby enemies when sprung.

Old Man Winter: Throws a ball of dry ice, freezing enemies or turning broken water pipes into ice bridges. Attacking frozen enemies shatters them. Charged effect lays down a shard of ice crystals, which encases nearby enemies in ice upon detonation.

Possession: Turns the targeted machine to the caster's side, causing vending machines to give out a cash bounty and fighter automatons to fight for the user. Charged effect deploys the Vigor as a stationary trap, possessing surrounding enemies when sprung.

Return to Sender: Creates a temporary repulsive electromagnetic shield, blocking all incoming gunfire. Charged effect while charging, absorbs all incoming bullets and projectiles. Upon release, either deploys as a stationary trap or explodes upon direct contact with an enemy, inflicting damage proportionate to the damage absorbed.

Shock Jockey: Shocks the target, temporarily stunning them and doubling the damage they take. Deals critical damage against enemies in contact with water. Can also activate electric generators. Charged effect deploys the Vigor as a stationary electrified field, shocking any enemy who approaches it.

Undertow: Throws all targets in front of the user back with a watery tendril, momentarily knocking them to the floor if they hit the ground. Charged effect pulls the selected target to the user and holds them in the air via a tentacle made of water, temporarily stunning them and increasing the damage they take.

name: Zi Mo
summary: Zi Mo is a True Element 6th stage cultivator from the Tian Lang Dynasty's Sen Luo Temple, an existence similar to the Great Han Dynasty's Eight Great Families. Zi Mo is from the Imperial Insect Faction making her akin to a princess of the Dynasty. She enters Nether Mountain with her 3 other senior disciples to enslave monster beasts and grow stronger. She eventually runs into Yang Kai and tries to control him but fails to do so and falls under his control. Although Yang Kai's cultivation is lower than hers, he still defeated her and she becomes attracted to him because of his strength and potential.

name: Dr. M
summary: Dr. M was the main antagonist of Sly 3: Honor Among Thieves. He was a former member of the Original Cooper Gang who later turned his back on his teammates and sought to steal the Cooper fortune from the Cooper Vault.

name: Captain Marvel (Carol Danvers)
summary: Carol Danvers was born to a human father and a Kree mother. She entered the air force at the age of 18, both due to her love of planes and her father's inability/unwillingness to send her to college. Eventually she would be placed on testing experimental air crafts for the air force, and working for Air Force Special Operations. Her career would shift again when she worked NASA as the Chief of State. During this tenure is when she met the original Captain Marvel. Due to the Psyche-Magnitron explosion an ancient Kree defence mechanism inside herself activated which granted her powers, with her new identity as Ms. Marvel she flew across Earth helping those in need, even joining the avengers after working together multiple times, until Rogue stole her powers and memories. With Charles Xavier's help she got her memories back befriending the X-Men for it. During a mission with X-Men she was experimented by the Brood regainning her old powers and more adopting the name Binary, after some time her powers decreased and once again she got back to being a Earth hero and an Avenger, this time with the name Warbird where she faced her demons in the form of alcoholism. After an encounter with Mar-Vell she decided to follow on his legacy becoming the new Captain Marvel.
abilities: Base
Binary Form

name: Two-Back (Silent Hill)
summary: Two-Back is one of the strongest non-boss monsters in Silent Hill: Origins. It appears in the Riverside Motel in several rooms and outside in both the Fog World and Otherworld, and in Nowhere.

name: Daredevil (Marvel Cinematic Universe)
summary: Matt Murdock is a blind lawyer in New York City's district of Hell's Kitchen, where he runs a firm with best friend Franklin "Foggy" Nelson. As a child, Matt was blinded by a toxic waste spill, yet enhanced Matt's other senses and gave him sonar to "see" via sonic vibrations. Matt was then orphaned when his boxer father, "Battling Jack" Murdock, was killed after refusing to turn in a fixed fight for a mobster.

name: Spike (BuffyVerse)
summary: Spike (born William Pratt) was a famous and widely-feared vampire turned in 1880.[1] He was well-known among both humans and demons for having faced and killed two Slayers during his unlife, as well as his history of torturing his victims with railroad spikes. His reputation for evil and bloodshed was second only to that of his grandsire Angelus.[2] In his human life, William was an unappreciated romantic poet known as William the Bloody, for his "bloody awful" poetry, though after he became a vampire, that moniker was re-purposed to imply he was very violent. After being sired by Drusilla, he reinvented himself and terrorized Europe alongside Drusilla, Angel, and Darla throughout the 19th and 20th centuries.[1]

name: Eris (Dreamworks)
categories: Sinbad: Legend of the Seven Seas

name: BanchoLeomon
summary: BanchoLeomon is a Beast Man Digimon which lives faithful only to the "Justice" in which it trusts. It is said that only Digimon who continue to emerge victorious in battles with fierce champions, without their spirit being "broken", are able to acquire the title of "Bancho", and only five Digimon which possess this title have been confirmed in the recorded history of the Digital World. As it is a boss that only serves its own "Justice", if something becomes an obstacle to that "Justice", it will see them as "Evil" even if they are a being like the Royal Knights or the Three Great Angels, and they will become an enemy that it has to eliminate. The "GAKU-RAN" worn over its shoulders is endowed with a defensive function that negates 89.9% of the opponent's physical strikes.

name: Mecha Dorat
summary: The Mecha Dorats (メカドラット, Meka Doratto?): are mechas antagonists of Godzilla-kun, Minilla, and Little Godzilla in the show Godziban.

name: Razul (Light Novel)
summary: He is an insect-type spiritual monster from a different world, who was named by his long-time friend Granbell Rosso a thousand years ago.

name: Datsueba
summary: Datsueba is a demon who appears in the Episode 8 "The Ogre of the Underworld: The Circuits That Lead to Hell". According to the ghost diary the demon was luring people who had become lost onto the road of the underworld, to the boats of the Sanzu River and then forced them to enter in a boat to cross the river, in other words to the underworld. However, it seemed that her activities were stymied with the installment of lights and road signs in the city. She now uses a legendary Internet site called Yomi-Net to operate the same scheme, in which Leo nearly becomes a victim. The way to defeat her is to present a talisman, and chant a wish to go back home.

name: Superman (Earth One)
summary: Sent from the destroyed world of Krypton, Kal-El was found and raised by the Kents as their son Clark, trying to blend in and hide his growing powers. Deciding to pursue a normal life and riches via the advantages his talents would offer, his hand was instead forced when Tyrell, a representative of the Dheronian race that destroyed his home world, pursued him to Earth to execute both him and the planet. With no other choice, he revealed himself to the world and defeated Tyrell, deciding to continue as a 'superhero', going on to battle enemies like Parasite, the Luthors, and his uncle Zod-El, the true architect of Krypton's destruction, as Superman.

name: Alexandre Dumas (Fate)
summary: False Caster is the servant summoned by Orlando Reeve during the Snowfield Holy Grail War.

name: The Spiral
summary: The Spiral is a mysterious geometric shape and force that manifests within the small town of Kurôzu-cho, causing supernatural phenomena, all centering around the massive spiral city located deep beneath it.

name: Nephilim (The God of High School)
summary: Nephilim are the captains of Heaven's legions, leading angels into the fray when called upon to battle. They follow their orders faithfully, committing any act in the name of heaven, particularly the destruction of the "vermin" that inhabit the Sage Realm.

name: Evolvosaurus
summary: The Evolvosaurus is a monster which can swap bodies with any creature it touches with it hands. This ability not only works on humans, but also on any creature that it can come into physical contact with. In its true form, it stands at 6 ft tall and weighs 400 lbs.[1]

name: Sailor Lead Crow (Manga)
summary: Sailor Lead Crow, of the planet "Coronis", is the third of the Sailor Animamates to be introduced in the manga and is one of the Sailor Animamates who serve under Sailor Galaxia. She comes from the same planet as Phobos and Deimos, servants to Sailor Mars. This is original depiction of the character created by Naoko Takeuchi.

name: Krisa
summary: Krisa, true name George Silva, is an important character in Castle. A legendary fighter from Iskra and one of their most proeminent ballerinos, Krisa is a living legend who had fought alongside people like Shin and Gustav, being a close friend of the former, and chosen by Medvedi to test people of great potential like Pi Woo-Jin. Serious, disciplined and ruthless, Krisa is an entirely different beast from most fighters of the series, putting high value in the technical aspects of the fight and being a mainly defensive fighter.

name: Kongkrete
summary: Mysterious buildings have been appearing all over the world. They are alive, is unknown what are they after.
abilities: Abilities
Resistances

name: Tina (Silent Hill)
summary: Tina is one of two protagonists in Silent Hill: The Arcade, along with Eric.

name: Felicia Mitsuki
summary: Felicia Mitsuki is the biggest trouble-maker of the Mikadzuki Household. Originally, she had a family to go but she accidentally set her apartment on fire, causing her parents to perish. Her wish to Kyubey moved the blame of the fire to a witch named Beatrice, inspiring her to become a magical girl that kills all witches.

name: Kagen
categories: Izuna: Legend of the Unemployed Ninja
summary: Kagen is a supporting character from Izuna: Legend of the Unemployed Ninja and its sequel. He's the hot-headed God of Fire, Health and Compassion. He's friendly and competitive, but also rather dumb. He's one of the few characters to get (decently) along with Mitsumoto. Despite being opposites, he also has a sibling-like relationship with Suiren.

name: Philippe Roaché
summary: Philippe Roaché is a supporting protagonist in the 1998 film GODZILLA, who also reappears in Godzilla: The Series.

name: Gatekeeper (Fire Emblem Heroes)
summary: Gatekeeper is a character that appears in Fire Emblem: Three Houses, as well as a summonable hero in Fire Emblem Heroes. He is a cheerful young man who greets everyone as they pass by him. As his name suggests, he is tasked with guarding the gates of whichever position he is assigned, whether it be a monastery, castle, or stronghold, as well as to report anything out of the ordinary. Though more often than not, he has nothing to report.
abilities: Elwind: Summons powerful gusts of wind on the opponent.
Rexcalibur: Sends powerful gusts of wind towards the opponent.

Charging Horn: Gatekeeper blows into this horn, summoning a giant gate which brings forth characters from Garreg Mach Monastery. Grants Def+3. Grants Atk/Spd+5 to allies within 3 rows or 3 columns centered on unit during combat. Grants effects to unit during combat based on the number of allies within 3 rows or 3 columns centered on unit: If ≥ 1 ally, inflicts Atk/Res -X on foe during combat (X = number of allies in the area × 2; max -6). If ≥ 3 allies, foe cannot make a follow-up attack. (If unit is within 2 spaces of a structure that a foe can destroy, the number of allies in the area is treated as 3.)

name: YoRHa No. 22 Type B
summary: A YoRHA deserter. Ordered to be apprehended by Command for abandoning its post, it put up a fierce resistance before being destroyed by 2B and 9S.
abilities: Base
Plug-in Chips
Resistances

name: Hans (Pumpkin Scissors)
summary: Hans is a soldier from one of the Empire's Invisible Nine (Nine platoons that don't exist officially due to being illegal under international treaties), specifically the late 908th High Temperature Troop, also known as the Alt Schmied Jäger. The youngest of the group, Hans was the only surviving member of his troop due to their faulty equipment. Hans was eventually found and recruited by the mysterious organization known as the Society of the Silver Wheel.

name: Rizka (Ejen Ali)
summary: Rizka (Real Name: Rizka Widjaya) is a character in Agent Ali who was first introduced as an agent of M.A.T.A. from the South Branch in the third season.

name: Serial Killer (Town of Salem)
summary: During the day, he shakes hands and makes friends, claiming to be the town's best doctor. However, in the night, he slowly wanders home through the streets of Salem to his humble abode. When he arrives, he pulls out a large knife and cleans it with the greatest of care, a piece of equipment for his patients, or for his victims? Little does this (not really) innocent town know that this person has been striking fear into their hearts for several nights, for, in the day, he acts as if he wishes to help, but in the night, he preys upon the weak using his worn weapon; slowly makes one unlucky soul of the town suffer each night. He is their nightmare: a Serial Killer.

name: Fang Yu
summary: Fang Yu is a member of the Fang Clan of planet East Victory, a disciple of the Church of the Immortal Emperor and Meng Hao's older sister. She is very frank and when angered, does not hesitate to get back at the one responsible. Though, she is very caring and protective of her family.

name: Tsunami
summary: Tsunami (津名魅, Tsunami) is a main character from Tenchi Muyo! Ryo-Ohki. She's one of the three Choushin, who created the multiverse in an attempt to find the proof of a being able to surpass them. To find it, she decided to create a race based on herself, which would become the Jurai Tree-Ships, able to use the Light Hawk Wings.

name: Anna (Epic Battle Fantasy)
summary: Anna Greenwood is a character in the Epic Battle Fantasy universe. She was first introduced as a playable character in the spin-off "Bullet Heaven" as a secret unlockable character and became the main protagonist of "Epic Battle Fantasy 4". Contrary to the other EBF "heroes", Anna is a selfless hero who isn't driven by personal gain. This trait put her at odds with the other characters.

name: Harbinger (DC Comics)
summary: Lyla Michaels, alias Harbinger was rescued from floating in the sea as a child by the Monitor, who then brought her onboard his satellite to raise her as his assistant, studying the Multiverse alongside him. Locked in eternal struggle for the fate of reality with his antimatter counterpart, the Anti-Monitor, the Monitor had chosen Lyla to act as his personal agent in observing, testing and preparing the world’s greatest heroes and villains for the day their battle spilled over into their universe. To accomplish this important task, the Monitor granted Lyla immense powers.

name: Ikaruga (Senran Kagura)
summary: Ikaruga (斑鳩) is a playable character in the Nintendo 3DS series of Senran Kagura. She makes her debut in Senran Kagura Burst.

name: Loki (High School DxD)
summary: Loki is one of the antagonists of High School DxD and one of the Evil Gods of Norse Mythology. His aim was to kill Odin and trigger Ragnarok before he was defeated and imprisoned in Asgard.

name: Balloony
summary: Balloony is a contestant from the Battle for Dream Island series, debuting during the fourth season, Battle for BFDI. He is a green rubber balloon, with limbs attached to a string. Balloony is generally a kind character, but he hates being told what to do and prefers to do tasks himself due to not trusting others. Balloony also gets overwhelmed and (literally) lightheaded in stressful situations, so he hates Cake at Steak (which is when contestants are suspensefully deemed safe or eliminated based on viewer voting). Balloony pretty much isn't well acquainted with any contestant in particular, but he seemed to get along with most of his teammates on Beep during pre-split BFB, especially with Cloudy. He also really enjoys Rocky's salt n' vinegar vomit.
abilities: Object Physiology (Regular)
Large Size ( Type 0 ; 4.18868009368 meters )
Inorganic Physiology ( Type 1 ; Is a living balloon)

name: Scáthach-Skadi
summary: Caster (キャスター, Kyasutā?) is a Caster-class Servant appearing in the Grand Orders of Fate/Grand Order.

name: Leo (Red Earth)
summary: Leo is one of the four protagonists of Red Earth and the monarch of the kingdom of Savalia (Greedia in Japan). One day, a tremendous force known as the Empire suddenly appeared and invaded the world, trampling everyone on its path, including Leo and his valiant soldiers, powerless before the mysterious sorcerer army. Leo was driven out of his country and cursed to change into a beast. Only the sacrifice of the three sages of the kingdom salvaged him from complete transmutation, making him into a half-man and half-beast instead. The rage and sorrow for the slaughter of his men pushed Leo to recover his human self and prompted him to depart on a quest to save the world.

name: Barinade
summary: Bio-Electric Anemone Barinade is the third boss of Ocarina of Time and the boss of Jabu Jabu's Belly. It's a parasite that gradually drains the energy of Lord Jabu Jabu, slowly killing him. Barinade's interference causes Lord Jabu Jabu to act irrationally, fully swallowing most things that come near to help alleviate its pain.

name: Supernova (Rick & Morty)
summary: Supernova is the "Cosmic Heroine" of the superhero team dubbed the Vindicators. She, along with her allies, act as the universes first line of defense against evil; using their powers to stop universe-ending forces such as Worldender and Doom-Nomitron.

name: Flamie
summary: Flamie are a slime-like species of monster from Puzzle and Dragons. They are known for being jelly-like and warm to the touch, so much so that humans try to use them for heating.

name: Thon
summary: Thon was a secretive and often reclusive male Tchuukthai Jedi Master who lived in the period surrounding the events of the Great Sith War. He kept the details concerning his race, homeworld, and origins a closely guarded secret, and possessed extensive knowledge of the Force even in as-yet-unknown techniques. Soon after first visiting the Jedi library world of Ossus, Thon became a Jedi Master, and went in search of a planet where he could live and study in solitude and peace. The Force guided him to Ambria, a planet in the Stenness Node that was plagued by the dark side. After containing the Sith influence to a single spot, Thon settled down and began to take Jedi apprentices, among them Oss Wilum and the future head of the Jedi Order, Nomi Sunrider.

name: Billy Rocks
summary: Billy Rocks is an assassin. In 1879, he was hired by Emma Cullen to save Rose Creek from Bartholomew Bogue, who had taken over the town. He joined bounty hunter Sam Chisholm, gambler Joshua Faraday, outlaw Vasquez, sharpshooter Goodnight Robicheaux, warrior Red Harvest, and tracker Jack Horne and together they became known as "the Magnificent Seven."

name: Hua Cheng
summary: Hua Cheng (花城, Huā Chéng), also referred to as San Lang (三郎, Sān Láng), is the deuteragonist in Heaven Official's Blessing.

name: Carnotaurus (Disney's Dinosaur)
summary: Carnotaurus, also known as Carnotaurs ("Meat-eating bull"), were a genus of abelisaurid carnivorous dinosaur that lived in the Late Cretaceous period, 72-69.9 million years ago in South America.

name: Jack Garland
summary: Jack Garland is the main protagonist of Stranger of Paradise: Final Fantasy Origin . A Lufenian originally, Jack was chosen for the stranger project, a project that involved him regulating the mortal world's flow of light and darkness so that Lufenia could prosper. This process stole the memories of him and his allies, leaving them only with a desire to kill the being known as Chaos, causing their deaths countless times before resetting. Jack devised a plan in the second to last Cycle of their mission to rebel against the Lufenians, take Chaos' Power and free the world from it's shackles.

name: Storm Guards
summary: The Storm Guards are soldiers/guards that are part of The Storm King's army in My Little Pony: The Movie.

name: Vána
summary: Vána is the younger sister of Yavanna and the wife of Oromë. In her dwellings were gardens filled with golden flowers, though Vána often came to the forests of Oromë. Like her sister, Vána had great control over life, and the growing things of the world was a lover of nature and life. Vána has great influence over the flora and fauna of Middle-earth, especially flowers, which she was deeply associated with thus Vána was also known as the "Queen of Flowers."

name: Elisabeth (The Eminence in Shadow)
summary: Elisabeth (エリザベート, Erizabēto?), known as the Blood Queen (血の女王, Chi no Joō?), is a Vampire Progenitor and a former leader of the Crimson Tower, one of the Three Monarchs of the Lawless City. Initially perceived as the ruler, she was, in fact, a figurehead manipulated by her subordinate, Crimson. Eventually, she relinquishes her position after being rescued by Shadow.
abilities: Superhuman Physical Characteristics & Longevity (Vampires possess superhuman characteristics and can live longer than humans by drinking blood [ 1 ] )

Regeneration ( Low-High ) & Immortality (Type 1, 2, 3, 4, 7 & 8. Elizabeth's heart possesses eternal integrity unless the upper center sustains severe damage. With the absorption of even a small amount of blood from a sacrificed body, her heart can restart, enabling her resurrection. Elizabeth boasts the strongest vampire regeneration, rebuilding all organs as long as her heart remains intact. She can even regenerate her entire body from just her blood, showcased when Aurora-possessed Claire destroyed her [ 1 ] )

Magic , Energy Projection & Explosion Manipulation (Even as an amateur, Alexia surprises with the ability to project magical energy, causing explosive effects [ 2 ] . This should extend to experienced people like Elizabeth)
Statistics Amplification ( Users can harness magic to boost their vision, speed, and power concurrently [ 2 ] )
Aura & Fear Manipulation ( Magic becomes an aura, inducing fear in opponents, creating an intimidating presence [ 1 ] )
Enhanced Senses ( Through magic, users can augment their vision capabilities, gaining enhanced sight [ 2 ] )
Extrasensory Perception (Should be capable of sensing magical energy of others)
Instinctive Action ( Superior to Rex who can evade attacks using only their instincts. Comparable to Epsilon who has sharpened skills which let her dodge attacks even when taken by surprise )

Blood Manipulation , Bodily Weaponry , Weapon Creation , Curse Manipulation , Corruption & Absorption ( Elisabeth possesses a formidable ability to control her own blood magically, utilizing it for offense and defense. Her power extends to manipulating the blood of other living beings. This skill enables her to launch blood projectiles, shape-shift her blood into weapons, steal blood from others, and induce blood paralysis or a vampire curse [ 1 ] . By absorbing the blood of her opponents, Elisabeth can become even more powerful than she already is, both in magic and otherwise [ 3 ] )
Danmaku ( She can create innumerable feelers, also filling the whole air around her with arrows made of blood [ 1 ] )
Clone Creation ( She has the ability to make blood copies of herself and control them at will [ 1 ] )

Physics Manipulation , Intangibility & Water Manipulation ( possesses the Mist Form ability, allowing her to transform her entire body or specific parts into mist. This grants her exceptional evasion skills, enabling her to dodge attacks and inflict damage simultaneously [ 1 ] )

Resistance to Power Nullification & Absorption (Should be comparable to Delta and Alpha who were able to defeat Nelson despite most of their magic being nullified and absorbed by the Sanctuary [ 4 ] . This nullification was said be stronger than what was used at Cid's school [ 4 ] )

name: Saming Dum (Home Sweet Home)
summary: Dum is a shapeshifter and a serial killer who was once just a diseased kid; he's been raised by an old thief gang member who was retried. One day, Dum found a dying tiger and saved its life, but later, an old thief gang member passed away, and the tiger disappeared. Later, Dum saw a tiger again, but it's majorly injured because of a hunter who hunted an animal in this forest, and Dum was mimicking a Preta voice to creep them away. Unfortunately, they came back and beat down Dum. Later, Dum found a diary of a thief gang member that mentioned magic and learned it to become an expert.

name: Ikumi Yaita
summary: Yaita Ikumi is an original member of the Hana-Gumi and the former Head of Kawa Mid.

name: The Sanguinor
summary: The Sanguinor, also known as the Exemplar of the Host and the Herald of Sanguinius, is a mysterious entity of unknown origin that is associated with the Blood Angels Space Marines Chapter, and has been named after Sanguinius, the Blood Angels' martyred Primarch. Not much is known about his origins, and what information does exist is really nothing more than speculation by the Chapter's Librarium and several Imperial scholars well-versed in the lore of the Adeptus Astartes. The Sanguinor often appears during the Blood Angels' periods of greatest need, usually during a combat situation. To many among the battle-brothers of the Chapter he is no more than a myth, as few ever survive the battles where he has manifested, but the initiates of the Blood Angels' Reclusiam know differently, having kept detailed records of his manifestations down through the centuries. While the Sanguinor's deeds are unquestioned, there has always been much debate concerning his origin and identity.
abilities: Powers
Resistances

name: Link (Skyward Sword)
summary: Link is the hero chosen by the goddess Hylia to perform a great task. A resident of Skyloft, he attends the Knight Academy, a boarding school for those wanting to become Knights of Skyloft. Like all denizens of The Sky, he owns his own Loftwing; in particular, he owns a rare Crimson Loftwing. At the beginning of the game, Link wears clothes similar to those worn by other residents of Skyloft. This incarnation of Link is the earliest known appearance of the character in the timeline, and due to the gameplay, which is designed for right-handed use, this Link seems to be right-handed as well. It is possible though, that the game was mirror imaged and thus this Link is also left-handed as well.

name: Ted Harrison
summary: Ted Harrison, also known as Uncle Ted is the main antagonist of the 1996 horror movie Bad Moon.

name: Es-N
summary: The Embryo Storage: Nu units, known also simply as Es-N or just Nu, are eight antagonists in XBlaze – Code: Embryo. They are mindless artificial beings who answer only to Sōichirō Unomaru, their creator. The ninth Es-N, a minor support character, was in development at the time of her sister units and creator’s death; she was adopted by Mei Amanohokosaka.

name: Nana (Madagascar)
summary: Nana is one of the antagonists in the Madagascar film series. She is an old lady who has a very fond attachment to her handbag, claiming she can't survive without it, though her fighting skills (demonstrated when she fought Alex) prove otherwise. In the second film Madagascar: Escape 2 Africa, where she has a larger role, Nana became the leader of an army of tourists after they were left by the Penguins' schemes and helped them survive in the wilderness by drying up the river after they built a giant dam.

name: Dan G (Def Jam FFNY)
summary: Dan G. was born in Jamaica, but raised in the USA. His family moved to New Jersey when he was less than a year old. He grew up learning capoeira and breakdancing around the Tri State area with a b-boy crew calling themselves The Str8 Breakers. The breakdancing bubble had burst by the end of the eighties, and Dan G. tried to make a name for himself as an emcee. He started street fighting as a means to pay for his demo, but found he had a knack for it. Now Dan's a star in the underground, busting heads with a style that keeps the crowds calling his name. He still dreams of being a famous rapper, but for now he finds happiness in the ring.

name: Arkhan the Black
summary: Arkhan the Black, known now and forever as the Liche King, was the first and most loyal of the evil Nagash's followers. He helped lead the coup which brought the arch-necromancer to power, and he was the first, after his Lord, to imbibe the Elixir of Life. Arkhan was the most adept of Nagash's pupils in the study of dark sorcery, and he quickly rose to become the necromancer's trusted vizier and principal lieutenant. He led many armies against Nagash's enemies and was never defeated in open combat. In the end, however, the sheer numbers of the Priest Kings' soldiers forced Nagash to retreat. It was Arkhan who led the suicidal counter-attack that gave Nagash the opportunity to escape. For over an hour he held back the Army of the Seven Kings through feats of martial prowess and powerful sorcery. Arkhan finally fell, not to a hero's sword, but to a single spear hurled by an unknown soldier. He stared in horror at the shaft protruding from his chest, knowing that it had pierced his heart. With his dying breath, he threatened that a terrible curse would befall any who touched his corpse, and with that, he slumped to the ground. Within seconds, dark flames had consumed Arkhan's flesh leaving behind only a blackened skeleton. Whilst the rest of Nagash's followers were beheaded and burnt, none dared risk desecrating Arkhan's remains, and so they covered them under a cairn of stones instead. Nagash did not forget his most able lieutenant, and when he returned to wreak vengeance on Nehekhara, Arkhan was reborn as the Liche King - the first of Nagash's nine Dark Lords. These foul beings were the foremost of Nagash's captains, and they brought despair and destruction to his foes.[2]
abilities: Superhuman Physical Characteristics (All Tomb Kings, even before being risen into undeath stronger then they ever were, were 7 foot tall and could literally rip normal humans limb from limb [ 2 ] )

Limited Nonexistent Physiology (Type 2; all aspects) & Abstract Existence (Type 1) & Acausality (Type 4, possibly type 5) & Nonduality (Type 2) (A part of all beings' mind and soul in Warhammer is made out of Aethyr and exists in the Realm of Chaos , [ 4 ] providing them with the same properties above and resides Low 1-A range away at minimum. In fact until a Mortal dies, even the Chaos Gods themselves cannot locate their souls despite being in their realm [ 5 ] )
Weapon Mastery

Immortality (Types 1; [Undead like Arkhan are unable to age, and with his own soul trapped in his body, he will continue to function forever] [ 6 ] and 7; [is a skeleton] [ 6 ] and 8; [Nagash can and will bring Arkhan back from the dead should he ever fall] [ 1 ] )
Self-Sustenance (Type 1, 2 and 3; via being undead [ 7 ] )

passive Curse Manipulation & Age Manipulation & Regeneration Negation ( Anyone who attempts to attack or slight a tomb king is inflicted with a curse that ages them a lifetime in mere seconds. [ 8 ] The Damage caused by this ability cannot be regenerated from [ 8 ] )

Summoning & Soul Manipulation & Sealing ( Can summon a Casket of Souls which emits a blinding light as countless souls pour out, stripping the souls of their victims and trapping them in the casket [ 8 ] )
Statistics Amplification (Can increase the skill of any allies near him [ 2 ] )

Life Manipulation & Deconstruction & Necromancy (The Tomb Blade of Arkhan instantly destroys any flesh it touches, leaving behind only a charred skeleton enslaved for all eternity to Arkhan's dark will [ 3 ] )

name: Tsukuyomi (Yamato Takeru Movie)
summary: Son of the gods Izanagi and Izanami, Tsukuyomi ruled over the underworld, while his sister Amaterasu ruled over the heavens and the Earth. Jealous of his sister’s position of power over all things on the Earth, Tsukuyomi transformed into a huge and murderous hydra, Orochi, dead-set on bringing about the end of the world. However, his brother Susanoo, the war god and lord of the seas, challenged the mighty behemoth and brought an end to the serpent’s reign of terror. He pulled the Sword of Dark Clouds from the snake’s body, the source of Tsukuyomi’s power. Izanagi, the father of the gods, feared the evil mind of his own flesh and blood, and thus casted him off into the deepest reaches of space, hoping he would never return.

name: The Quiet
summary: The Quiet, also referred as The Absolute or The Unmade, is the one sole true Godhead of Sun Eater. He is the unmade maker, the being itself, the ruler of all creation. He serves as one of moving thematic forces in the series, the truth of Him pushing protagonist of the series, Hadrian Marlowe, to defend and save the place of humanity within creation against Watchers who seek to undermine his race.

name: Mayumi Tetsuji
summary: Mayumi Tetsuji is one of Snake Head officials. Tetsuji's legacy was punctuated by bold and audacious maneuvers, including a surprise attack on Harumichi Bouya alongside fellow Snake Head operatives, Ooshima Tomoyuki and Shiga Yukio, culminating in the kidnapping of Tamasu Tsuyoshi. In subsequent encounters, Tetsuji exhibited his prowess by incapacitating the injured Parko and orchestrating the abduction of Tamasu once more in a bid to ensnare the remaining adversaries, particularly targeting Zetton.

name: Jodie Holmes
summary: Jodie Holmes is a young girl that has been since her birth linked to a mysterious entity called Aiden that only her can see. The two are connected to each other by a thread preventing them from going their own ways. When she was 9, her adoptive parent no longer felt like they could take care of her and left her under the care of the doctor Nathan Dawkins, a scientist of the DPA (Department of Paranormal Activities) studying the paranormal who seeked to understand Aiden's nature.  When she was 17, seeking to use her powers for military purpose the CIA recruited her within their ranks.

name: Captain Sabertooth
summary: Captain Sabertooth (Kaptein Sabeltann in the original Norwegian) is Norway's most famous and beloved pirate. He was first introduced to the Norwegian public in 1990, as the villain of an outdoors musical play at Kristiansand Zoo and Amusement Park, called Captain Sabertooth and the Treasure in Luna Bay. This play spawned several sequels and spin-off products, and since then Captain Sabertooth been the front and center of one of Norway's most successful multimedia franchises, having starred in movies, TV series, animated films, theater plays, books, comic books, video games and even theme park attractions.

name: Kokushibo
summary: Kokushibo (黒死牟, Kokushibō?) is the secondary antagonist of Demon Slayer: Kimetsu No Yaiba. He was a demon affiliated with the Twelve Kizuki, holding the highest position, Upper Rank 1 (上弦の壱, Jōgen no Ichi?). As a Kizuki, Kokushibo is one of the closest servants of the King of Demons, Muzan Kibutsuji, whose main purpose is to find the Blue Spider Lily so that Muzan can gain immunity from the sun.
abilities: Demon
Human/Michikatsu Tsugikuni

name: Connor Jordan
summary: Connor Jordan is a major antagonist in season four of Vampire Diaries.

name: Utahraptor (Jurassic Fight Club)
summary: Utahraptor is a character that appears in the TV show Jurassic Fight Club and a playable character in the game Turf Wars.

name: Ice Dragon
summary: The Ice Dragon is a portly, bipedal dinosaur-like monster who appears as a recurring boss and foe to Kirby.

name: Cramorant
summary: Cramorant is a blue, bird Pokémon resembling a cormorant. It has bright green, large, circular eyes with small pupils and a large, thin yellow beak. It has a ruff of light gray feathers that goes around its torso and sticks out at the back, making them resemble a bib. Its tail feathers have a small dot-shaped marking of this same shade of gray. It has a ruff of feathers on its head, with the largest clump pointing backward and being surrounded by small singular feathers. Its feet are black, webbed, and have three toes. Its wings seem to be perpetually extended.

name: Mr. Penguin
summary: Mr. Penguin is a major character in The Penguin Saga. He is good friends with Fernando Miguel. He eventually becomes trapped in the void due to his depression, and an alternate universe version of himself takes his place. This alternate Mr. Penguin begins killing people to end their suffering from existence, which he believes to be a relentless march towards inevitable oblivion.

name: Utsunomiya Toramaru
summary: Utsunomiya Toramaru is a character from Inazuma Eleven, introduced in Season 3 as one of Inazuma Japan’s forwards in the FFI. Toramaru is the youngest member on the team, who was already an extremely talented player to the point he had been shunned and excluded from his prior team out of envy. This discouraged Toramaru from using his full potential again in fear that it would do the same to any of his future teams, however this was resolved with the help of Gouenji during the match against the Desert Lions. Toramaru also has a sickly mother, and tends to help her out with her restaurant alongside his sister.

name: Zoffy
summary: Zoffy (ゾフィー, Zofī?) is the commander of the Inter Galactic Defense Force, as well as the second member and leader of the Ultra Brothers. He first appeared after the defeat of Ultraman at the hands of Zetton, bringing the Ultra back to the Land of Light. Zoffy would later return to earth multiple times, helping his brothers in defending the planet

name: Deadend Crow
summary: Deadend Crow, also known as the "Titan of Eternal Darkness", was a giant machine body operated by Cure, and one of the Oración Seis Galáctica.
abilities: Base
Overdrive

name: Loran Darkbeast
summary: The Loran Darkbeast is a Chalice Dungeon boss in Bloodborne. Judging from its name, the Loran Darkbeast likely originates from the land of Loran, which was, long ago, devoured by the sands, the tragedy having said to have its roots with the scourge of the beast.

name: Trace (Gravity Circuit)
summary: Trace is the Patch Circuit and former member of the Guardian Corps, until she defected to the Virus Army some time after the battle for unknown reasons at the time. Trace was an inventive bot, always tinkering with her creations, having big ambitions with her constructs which often conflcited with her own duties, where she would find herself busy to help any bot who needed aid from her, which is what led the Guardian Corps to build their own medbay.

name: Cless
summary: Cless (クレス, Kuresu) is the hero of the human world and the younger brother of Helck.

name: Veldora Tempest (Web Novel)
summary: Veldora Tempest is the youngest of the four strongest dragons, the True Dragons. He was the one who gave Rimuru Tempest his name, and Rimuru, in turn, gave him his last name.

name: Miltiades Malachite
summary: Miltiades "Miltia" Malachite is a character introduced in the "Yellow" Trailer. She and her twin sister, Melanie Malachite, are seen working for Hei Xiong at his club, where they fight Yang Xiao Long. Miltia's weapons of choice are her claws.

name: Delphine
summary: Delphine is a Breton Blade and one of the Dragonborn's allies in Skyrim. A survivor of the Thalmor purge on the Blades in the Great War, she is responsible for many of the quests in the story, including sending the Dragonborn to infiltrate the Thalmor Embassy to find out what they know about the dragon attacks, leading him/her to discover Esbern, and in turn, Alduin's wall, where he/she learned that Dragonrend was the key to defeating Alduin.

name: Bruce Nolan
summary: Bruce Nolan is a reporter living with his long term girlfriend Grace Connelly in Buffalo, New York. He is the main protagonist of Bruce Almighty.

name: The Player (Dragon Ball Z: Dokkan Battle)
summary: The Player is the main protagonist of Dragon Ball Z: Dokkan Battle and a member of the Time Patrol.

name: Qin Mu
summary: Qin Mu is the main character of the Chinese novel Tales of Herding Gods. He was an orphan found on a basket on a river that was picked by Granny Su and Old Ma who took him to the Disabled Elderly village and thus he got raised by nine disabled elders. He is taught by them all kinds of techniques, wisdom, jobs and much more. At the age of 14 after defeating them in their own specialization on the same realm, he is let out to explore the world and thus his journey begins.
abilities: Abilities
Resistance

name: King Anumaril
summary: Anumaril was an ancient Ayleid King of the Late Merethic Era of Tamriel, when the Ayleid Empire was at the height of its power, he ruled over the dark city of Abagarlas, inhabited by proud warriors and mercenary worshippers of Molag Bal, the Daedric Prince of Rape and Enslavement.

name: Elizabeth Bathory (Majo Taisen)
categories: Majo Taisen - The War of Greedy Witches
summary: Elizabeth Bathory is a character in Majo Taisen - The War of Greedy Witches and a participant of Walpurgis, a one-on-one tournament between witches to determine whose desire is strongest, and be granted their wish by Agrat Bat Mahlat. She was a Hungarian countess in the 1500s, who when young, had accidentally slit the throat of her servant. This occurance led to Elizabeth gaining a taste for bloody murder, and went on to torture 650 people to death in her lifetime, even the likes of children. She was even labelled as a vampire who drank and bathed in the blood of her enemies. This bloodlust became so strong that it opened the power of her desire, and thus made her into a witch.

name: Lily Feng
summary: Lily Feng is a pre-made Sim who that lives in San Myshuno. She lives together with her husband, and is the C.E.O. of her company.

name: Immortal Enemy
summary: The Immortal Enemy, as the name implies is an immortal elemental monster whose sole purpose in life is to kill the Geomancer. Geomancers are powerful elementals chosen by Earth itself to protect her from the darkness, so the Immortal Enemy kills them in every generation to bring a dark age to this planet.

name: Ponman
summary: Ponmen are inhabitants of the Card Kingdom Dark World. Having been described by their fellow Darkners as simple and not fully in control of their own actions, they loyally serve under King, standing guard and attacking anyone entering the Great Board region.

name: Cashmere and Velvet
summary: Cashmere and Velvet, (later; Cashmere Biskit and Velvet Biskit) are two chinchillas adopted by the Biskit Twins only for them to be excused from classes, however, the two grow to like the two pets for the Biskits being able to see themselves in them. The two are sassy, rude, and blunt. They play the role as anti-heroes in their debut episode, and afterwards become minor antagonists.

name: Juhani Otso Berg
summary: Juhani Otso Berg (born 1985) is a former member of the Finnish Special Forces and a high-ranking agent of the Operations Division of Abstergo Industries, as well as the leader of Sigma Team.

name: Ten Kunimiya
summary: Ten Kunimiya is a major antagonist in the series Dessert Eagle. He is also the childhood friend/rival of Ichigo Washio. Ten is the leader of the criminal Yakuza "Ten'Ichi" which is a combination of his name and The beginning of Ichigo's name "ichi" with hopes Ichigo joins him one day due to them being "different" from everybody else.

name: Pandorym
summary: An unfathomable being that comes from an alien reality that was summoned to the prime multiverse by mages worried about reprisal from the gods. Pandorym wants nothing more than to fulfill its ancient contract and return to its home reality. Unfortunately for reality, his contract is the complete destruction of the Gods and therefore the multiverse itself.

name: Nanomech
summary: Nanomech is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of a Nanochip/Human hybrid.

name: Lemming (Lemmings)
summary: Lemmings are the main protagonists in the titular video game series, where they mindlessly walk forward, so the player has to make them avoid pits and traps by giving them special tasks, such as building a ladder, breaking walls, blocking other Lemmings, etc. When a Lemming hits a wall, it walks right back. The objective of each level is to safely guide a predetermined number of Lemmings from the start point to the exit door.

name: Titan Fluctuating Gravity Well
summary: A mysterious object buried under the surface of Titan, the satellite of Saturn. Can alter its own mass and create fluctuations in gravity. Rumored to actually be the "Sirius Buster Machine". The giant fluctuating gravity well awakens due to the Twins' resuscitation procedure.

name: Quetzalcoatl (Miss Kobayashi's Dragon Maid)
summary: Lucoa is a main character of the manga series; Miss Kobayashi’s Dragon Maid.

name: Drex Stinklebaum
summary: Drex Stinklebaum is a dangerous super villain in Henry Danger. He was Captain Man's original sidekick before turning to a life of crime.

name: Infantry (Guts & Blackpowder)
summary: The Infantry is a general well-rounded offensive class, specialized with their long ranged class for precise attacks against high-priority targets.

Weapon Mastery

Limited Regeneration ( Mid-Low; Can recover from severe burns from being lit on fire, [ 1 ] although they don't gain back any health from this)

name: Copy the Code
summary: Copy the Code (コピー・ザ・コード, Kopī Za Kōdo) is one of the antagonists of Neptunia: Game Maker R:Evolution. She is a Pirate Maker employed at Magicompany (Ar Co. in the localization) and is one of the members of the Copy Clique Trio. She is a programmer who makes a living off of analyzing sold games and copying their software before selling them as their own.
